0.title: IAS officer Tina Dabi takes charge as Jaisalmer Collector, shares pics from new office
0.article_body: IAS officer Tina Dabi, a UPSC 2015 exam topper, on Wednesday took charge as the District Collector and Magistrate of Jaisalmer in Rajasthan. Dabi, who was earlier posted in Jaipur as a joint secretary in the finance department of Rajasthan government, shared the news on social media with pictures of herself working in her new office.

1.title: JP Morgan cuts price target for Tesla as deliveries drop for 1st time in 2 yrs
1.article_body: JP Morgan analysts cut their price target for Tesla shares by $10 to $385 as it reported fall in deliveries for the first time in two years. The analysts said Tesla's production and financial results could be affected by execution issues at its new factories in Texas and Berlin. Recently, CEO Elon Musk described both factories as "gigantic money furnaces".

2.title: Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi resigns as Union Minister of Minority Affairs
2.article_body: Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi resigned as the Union Cabinet Minister of Minority Affairs on Wednesday, ANI reported. His term as Rajya Sabha MP is set to end soon. The resignation comes hours after reports claimed that Prime Minister Narendra Modi praised him at the Cabinet meeting for his contribution to the country and people.

3.title: I had to sell my office due to the COVID-19 pandemic: Ram Gopal Varma
3.article_body: Filmmaker Ram Gopal Varma said he had to sell his office because of the COVID-19 pandemic. Talking about his films not doing well during the COVID-19 pandemic, the filmmaker who directed 'Satya' stated, "During this time, a lot of films by a lot of people [haven't] done well. It is not just about my films, but no one targets others."

4.title: Lees used to bat like Boycott, but now he's batting aggressively: Vaughan
4.article_body: Former England captain Michael Vaughan has said England batters are changing their batting style according to the new 'aggressive' approach of captain Ben Stokes and Test head coach Brendon McCullum. "Players like Alex Lees, who only 6 weeks ago was batting like Geoffrey Boycott, wanted to bat for long periods of time...has [now] come out batting aggressively," explained Vaughan.

5.title: Business is currently firm for our chip industry: Taiwan amid slowdown
5.article_body: Taiwan's Economy Minister Wang Mei-hua said on Wednesday that the business for the country's semiconductor industry is currently "firm". The order books of Taiwan's chip firms "are still very full", she added. Her assurance came after American chip manufacturer Micron Technology said last week that the chip market had "weakened considerably in a very short period of time".

6.title: Congress denied probe into Shyama Prasad Mukherjee's death: JP Nadda
6.article_body: BJP National President JP Nadda, on the birth anniversary of Shyama Prasad Mukherjee, said the Congress denied an inquiry into the "mysterious" death of the leader. "Only Congress and Nehru know why...inquiry was not conducted," Nadda added. He further lauded PM Modi and Home Minister Amit Shah for scrapping Article 370 in J&K, calling it a "true tribute" to Mukherjee.

7.title: Delhi Congress leader Tarvinder Singh Marwah joins BJP
7.article_body: Congress leader Tarvinder Singh Marwah, who was an MLA for three terms in the Delhi Assembly, joined the BJP on Wednesday. Speaking to reporters, Marwah criticised Congress leadership for allegedly ignoring longtime members and appealed to all the G-23 leaders of Congress to join BJP. He further praised PM Narendra Modi, saying that there has been no PM like him.

8.title: TRS leader celebrates birthday on Hyderabad road, causes traffic jam
8.article_body: Telangana Rashtra Samithi leader and former Hyderabad mayor Bonthu Rammohan and his supporters played music and burst crackers to celebrate his birthday on a road in Hyderabad. Reports said that the celebrations caused a traffic jam and blocked the way for commuters. The TRS leader reportedly sprayed champagne before brandishing handheld crackers in both hands, Times Now reported.

9.title: How can India still qualify for World Test Championship final?
9.article_body: India are currently fourth on WTC points table. India can take their percentage of points won to 68.05% if they win each of their remaining six fixtures. India would need to beat Australia 4-0 and expect them to lose at least four more matches for a better chance to qualify. India would also need South Africa to lose three matches.

10.title: Always been in awe of your kindness: Madhavan on Hrithik's Rocketry tweet
10.article_body: Reacting to Hrithik Roshan's tweet on actor R Madhavan's recent film 'Rocketry: The Nambi Effect', the latter tweeted, "I have always been in awe of your kindness bro..but this is another level." "It means the world to...[me]. You will always be my special hero," added Madhavan. "The brilliant word-of-mouth for Rocketry...has left me with FOMO!" read the tweet from Hrithik.

11.title: I bury face in pillow, can't see his pic without breaking down: Saira on Dilip
11.article_body: Ahead of late actor Dilip Kumar's death anniversary, his wife Saira Banu said she cannot look at the late actor's picture without breaking down. "I...bury my face in the pillow and try to go back to sleep... as if by doing so I will...see him sleeping by my side...Not a moment passes...when he is not before my eyes," she added.

12.title: LPG costliest for Indians while unemployment at peak: Varun Gandhi
12.article_body: BJP MP Varun Gandhi said that at a time when unemployment is at its peak, Indians have to buy LPG at the highest price in the world. The statement comes after domestic LPG cylinder's price was increased by ₹50. "The connection cost increased from ₹1,450 to ₹2,200," Gandhi said. "The poor's kitchen is filling with smoke again," he added.

13.title: Spirit of our culture can't be trivialised by anybody: Singhvi on Mahua's remark
13.article_body: Congress leader Abhishek Singhvi reacted to TMC's Mahua Moitra's remark on goddess Kaali, saying that people must be careful when they "play" with emotions of people, which are reflected in such symbols, culture and faith. "Heart and spirit of our culture cannot be trivialised by anybody, anywhere be it elsewhere, abroad or here," he added.

14.title: B'luru college students complain of overflowing toilet waste on campus
14.article_body: The students of Bengaluru's Sri Jayachamarajendra Polytechnic College have complained of overflowing toilet waste near the campus gate, canteen and classrooms. A student said, "Stinking smell from the toilet waste is unbearable...It's difficult to focus on classroom teaching." Meanwhile, the NSUI has submitted a report to the Principal Secretary of Higher Education, seeking immediate intervention.

15.title: Ruturaj won't get opportunity in 1st England T20I: Aakash Chopra
15.article_body: Cricketer-turned-commentator Aakash Chopra has said Ruturaj Gaikwad is unlikely to feature in India's XI for the first T20I against England. "Rohit is back...Who goes out? Ruturaj won't get another opportunity but will Sanju Samson retain his place?" asked Aakash. Ruturaj scored 3 runs in the first T20 warm-up game against Derbyshire. The first T20I will be played on Thursday.

16.title: Tamil Nadu waiting for an Eknath Shinde: State BJP chief Annamalai
16.article_body: Following a change of regime in Maharashtra, state BJP chief K Annamalai said that Tamil Nadu is also gearing up for a cabinet shuffle. "Tamil Nadu cabinet headed by DMK leader M K Stalin is also...waiting for an Eknath Shinde to emerge," he claimed. DMK, however, described Annamalai's comments as "insignificant" and said "the party is not taking him seriously".

17.title: ED summons crypto exchanges, seeks info under FEMA: Reports
17.article_body: Enforcement Directorate (ED), which is probing alleged instances of foreign exchange violations, has summoned CoinSwitch Kuber, CoinDCX and other crypto exchanges in the case, as per reports. The agency is reportedly seeking details like transaction history under Foreign Exchange Management Act (FEMA). "ED is examining every detail on offshore transactions," an official told The Economic Times.

18.title: Tibetan issue not only political matter but matter of truth: Dalai Lama
18.article_body: Tibetan issue is not only a political matter but a matter of truth, Dalai Lama said on Wednesday. "What we have is truth on our side," he added. "We have not been telling lies. We have been sincere in our struggle. So, for all these years I've worked sincerely, respecting law," he stated.

19.title: Bangkok-Delhi Vistara flight lands at Delhi airport on a single engine, passengers safe
19.article_body: A Bangkok-Delhi Vistara flight landed at Delhi airport on Tuesday on a single engine. The airline said that the crew decided to tow the aircraft to the parking bay keeping in mind passenger safety and comfort. All the passengers are safe and the matter was reported to Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA).

20.title: China's BYD surpasses Tesla to become world's top-selling EV brand: Report
20.article_body: Chinese automaker BYD has reportedly surpassed Elon Musk's Tesla to become the world's top-selling electronic vehicle (EV) brand in the first half of 2022. While BYD sold 641,000 EVs between January and June this year, the figure stood at 564,000 for Tesla, Financial Times reported. Tesla's supply and production chain was disrupted after China imposed lockdowns due to COVID-19.

21.title: 76-million-year-old dinosaur skeleton to be auctioned in New York
21.article_body: A skeleton of a Gorgosaurus dinosaur that roamed on the earth about 76 million years ago will be auctioned for the first time, auction house Sotheby's announced. The Gorgosaurus skeleton will highlight Sotheby's natural history auction in New York on July 28, it added. The Gorgosaurus, an apex carnivore, predates its relative the Tyrannosaurus rex by 10 million years.

22.title: Launch of second version of Vande Bharat trains in Aug: Ashwini Vaishnaw
22.article_body: Minister for Railways Ashwini Vaishnaw has said that the Indian Railways will launch an upgraded second version of the semi-high-speed Vande Bharat trains in August 2022. "The first two trains started operating in 2019. So far, both the trains have travelled 14 lakh kilometres," he added. "Last year, 75 more trains [were] approved that are under production," Vaishnaw stated.

23.title: Hyderabad civic body raises awareness on mosquito-borne diseases
23.article_body: The Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) has asked people to take steps to stop the spread of infectious and seasonal diseases during the monsoon season. The civic body is working to raise awareness on mosquito-borne illnesses. GHMC officials also conducted door-to-door fever examinations and carried out fogging operations.

24.title: India asks Sri Lanka to make advance payments for fuel: Report
24.article_body: India is seeking advance payments for fuel shipments to cash-strapped Sri Lanka amid the latter's ongoing economic crisis, Bloomberg has reported. India has already extended assistance worth $3.5 billion to Sri Lanka in form of supplies, including food and fuel. Sri Lanka needs $587 million to pay for fuel shipments, a minister had earlier said.

25.title: We've reached a stage where one can't say anything on religion: Tharoor on Mahua's remark
25.article_body: Following a controversy over TMC MP Mahua Moitra's remarks on Goddess Kali, Congress leader Shashi Tharoor tweeted, "We've reached a stage where no one can say anything publicly about any aspect of religion without someone claiming to be offended." Tharoor said he was taken aback by the attack on Moitra as Hindus know that forms of worship vary across India.

26.title: Facing Djokovic at Wimbledon is one of the most difficult tasks in tennis: Norrie
26.article_body: World number 12 Cameron Norrie, who'll face Novak Djokovic in Wimbledon 2022 semi-final, has said facing Djokovic on grass is one of the most difficult tasks in tennis. "I'd say that grass is his favourite surface, and his track record is unbelievable...I will have to improve my level," he added. Djokovic is unbeaten in his last 26 matches at Wimbledon.

27.title: French engine maker Safran to set up MRO facility in Hyderabad
27.article_body: French engine maker Safran will set up a maintenance, repair and overhaul (MRO) facility in Hyderabad with investment of $150 million. The facility will be for LEAP-1A and LEAP-1B engines being used in aircraft by both Indian and foreign commercial airlines. The defence ministry said the MRO facility will be able to overhaul more than 250 engines per year initially.

28.title: Told Uddhav we aren't getting any benefit from MVA: CM Shinde
28.article_body: Maharashtra's newly appointed CM Eknath Shinde said that he had told former CM Uddhav Thackeray that they [Shiv Sena] are not getting any benefit from Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA). "Despite our party's CM, we came at number four in Nagar Panchayat [polls]...We tried but we didn't succeed [in making him understand]," Shinde said on Wednesday.

29.title: Bus service from West Bengal's Siliguri to Kathmandu begins
29.article_body: State Transport Minister Firhad Hakim flagged off a bus service between Siliguri in West Bengal and Kathmandu in Nepal on Wednesday. The 40-seater bus will operate from Siliguri on Monday, Wednesday and Friday every week and will depart for Kathmandu at 3 pm. Tickets are available at ₹1,500 per person. The service will boost tourism in the region, officials said.

30.title: PM wishes 'long life & good health' to Dalai Lama on his 87th birthday
30.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi greeted Dalai Lama on his 87th birthday during a phone call on Wednesday. "We pray for his long life and good health," PM Modi tweeted. The Tibetan spiritual leader, who has been living in exile in India after fleeing China in 1959, was also greeted by several other political leaders from the country.

31.title: Shanghai shuts karaoke venues after recent COVID-19 outbreak
31.article_body: KTV karaoke venues have been ordered to shut in Shanghai after a recent outbreak of COVID-19 from one such venue in the city. Cultural places like libraries will, however, be allowed to stay open. The cinemas and performance venues will also be allowed to reopen from Friday as per schedule, according to an official.

32.title: 4 drug peddlers arrested in B'luru; 70 grams of MDMA crystals seized
32.article_body: The Narcotics Squad of Bengaluru City Police's Central Crime Branch (CCB) has arrested four drug peddlers, who are said to be from Kerala, the city's Joint Commissioner of Police (Crime), Raman Gupta, said on Tuesday. Four iPhones and 70 grams of MDMA crystals, estimated to be worth ₹11 lakh, have been seized from their possession, Gupta added.

33.title: Toronto apologises after Sikh guards fired over 'no-beard policy'
33.article_body: Canada's Toronto has apologised to a prominent Sikh organisation for delay in reinstating Sikh security guards who were fired over 'no-beard policy'. Over 100 guards were terminated from several establishments after they were required to shave their beards so that they could wear N95 masks. City officials will allow 'under-mask beard covers' for people who wish to maintain facial hair.

34.title: Lalu Prasad Yadav to be shifted to Delhi, Bihar CM meets him at Patna hospital
34.article_body: RJD chief Lalu Prasad Yadav, who fractured his shoulder after falling off stairs, will be shifted to Delhi, RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav said. Bihar CM Nitish Kumar on Wednesday met the RJD chief at Paras Hospital in Patna, where he has been admitted currently. "If situation calls for us to take him to Singapore, we will," Tejashwi added.

35.title: All in politics called to enquire about Lalu Yadav’s health: Tejashwi
35.article_body: Former Bihar CM Lalu Prasad Yadav's son Tejashwi Yadav on Wednesday said that everyone in politics, including Rahul Gandhi and PM Narendra Modi, called to enquire about the ex-CM's health condition. "Everyone knows about his kidney & heart issues for which treatment was going on in Delhi," he said. We're in this together, he added.

36.title: 'Kaali' film director's old tweet on PM Modi surfaces amid controversy over poster
36.article_body: Indian-born Canada-based filmmaker Leena Manimekalai's 2013 tweet on PM Narendra Modi has resurfaced amid controversy over her film Kaali's poster. "I will surrender my passports, ration card, PAN card and my citizenship if ever Modi becomes this country's PM in my lifetime. I swear," she wrote. Sharing her tweet, filmmaker Ashoke Pandit said, "You've not stuck to your commitment."

37.title: Dutch university recovers $511,302 paid in ransom in 2019 hack
37.article_body: The University of Maastricht has recovered a ransom it paid in Bitcoin to hackers in 2019. The Netherlands Public Prosecution Service was able to seize cryptocurrencies worth approximately $511,302. "While it may seem like a lot of money, it is significantly less than the damage the university actually suffered as a result of the attack," the university said.

38.title: Ex-BJP worker, husband named in K'taka PSI exam scam first charge-sheet
38.article_body: A former BJP worker, Divya Hagaragi, and her husband have been named in the first charge-sheet filed in the Karnataka PSI exam scam case. The headmaster of a school, owned by Hagaragi, and three teachers at the school have also been named. The school served as an examination centre for the PSI recruitment exam in October 2021.

39.title: Fire breaks out at car showroom in Gurugram, 6 tenders rushed to spot
39.article_body: A massive fire broke out at a car showroom in Gurugram where two employees were trapped, officials said on Tuesday. Around six tenders were rushed to the spot and the fire was doused within an hour. The incident took place when employees turned on an AC on the first floor. Records of the company, chairs and tables were destroyed.

40.title: Locals turn giant pothole into a 'beach' for protest in MP, pics go viral
40.article_body: Locals in the Anuppur district of Madhya Pradesh staged a unique protest by turning a giant pothole into a community 'beach'. Locals decorated the area around the pothole with flowers, placed benches and set up food stalls for the protest. The idea for the protest came after repeated requests to repair the run-down road elicited no response from the administration.

41.title: Nearly ₹15 crore raised for 2-yr-old boy orphaned in US mass shooting
41.article_body: Nearly $1,900,000 (₹15 crore) has been raised for the 2-year-old boy who was found wandering alone at the US Independence Day parade shooting site after his parents were killed in the massacre. Aiden was unharmed and was handed over to his grandparents. The GoFundMe page was established to help Aiden's family with "raising, caring for and supporting" him.

42.title: 9 govt school teachers in UP use fake documents to secure job, booked
42.article_body: Services of nine government primary school teachers were terminated in UP's Pratapgarh for allegedly using fake certificates to secure teaching posts, an official said. FIR was lodged against the teachers. The action was taken when an online verification of the TET documents of these teachers, appointed in October 2020, revealed that their qualifying certificates are fake, the official added.

43.title: India squad for ODI series against West Indies announced, Shikhar Dhawan named captain
43.article_body: Team India squad for the three-match ODI series against West Indies has been announced. Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli, Rishabh Pant and Jasprit Bumrah have been rested, while Shikhar Dhawan has been named the captain. Shubman Gill, who last played an ODI in December 2020, has also been included in the 16-member squad. Ravindra Jadeja has been named vice-captain.

44.title: Everyone does everything together in the Kapoor family: Alia Bhatt
44.article_body: Discussing her experience as a part of the Kapoor family following her marriage to Ranbir Kapoor, Alia Bhatt said, "[I've] been brought up between me, my mum, my sister and my father...Our interaction was very limited." "We [didn't] have these massive celebrations...Everybody did their own thing...Enter the Kapoor family, where everyone does everything [like eating, aarti] together," added Alia.

45.title: Pair of Shinde, Fadnavis to make Maha prosper: Fadnavis' wife Amruta
45.article_body: Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis' wife Amruta Fadnavis said that the "ED pair", CM Eknath Shinde and Devendra Fadnavis, will make the state prosper with their hard work. "Difficult situations change but strong people always last," Amruta added. On Tuesday, state Deputy CM said, "We'll work round the clock to make Maharashtra the number one state in [India]."

46.title: Lt Gen Subramanian appointed as Force Commander of UN Mission in S Sudan
46.article_body: UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres has appointed Lieutenant General Mohan Subramanian of the Indian Army as his new Force Commander of the UN Mission in South Sudan (UNMISS). He succeeds Lieutenant General Shailesh Tinaikar of India. Subramanian "most recently...served as the General Officer Commanding, Military Region (Operational and Logistic Readiness Zone) in central India", the UN said.

47.title: For me, fitness is feeling good about myself: Anil Kapoor on staying fit at 65
47.article_body: Actor Anil Kapoor, in a new video, revealed his fitness routine at 65 and said that it included proper sleep and a balanced diet. "For me, fitness is feeling good about myself. I try and balance it with my workouts," he added. "My trainer Mark makes a plan...and I do exactly what he tells me to do," Anil said.

48.title: Amarnath Yatra resumes after suspension due to bad weather
48.article_body: A day after remaining suspended due to bad weather, Amarnath Yatra resumed on Wednesday morning, as another batch of 5,982 left from Jammu towards the Valley. "Of these 3,363 are going to Pahalgam base camp while 2,619 are going to Baltal base camp," officials said. Over 65,000 have visited the shrine this year since the yatra started on June 30.

49.title: 4 minor girls rescued from child labour in Telangana
49.article_body: Rachakonda Police rescued four minor girls aged between 11 and 17 from child labour in Mangalpally village of Telangana. The girls who were exploited illegally for labour work belong to Chhattisgarh. The accused was running a manufacturing company of disposable glasses and thermocol plates. He made the children work for over 12 hours and paid them ₹270 each per day.

50.title: Everyone would criticise me, they didn't know what I was facing: Arjun
50.article_body: Actor Arjun Kapoor said "everyone would criticise" him at one point of time, adding that they didn't know what he was going through. Arjun stated that it was "tough emotionally" for him at one stage. "To everyone who trolled me, who criticised me, who hated me, I say thank you," he said. "I will...keep coming back for more," stated Arjun.

51.title: Is this cost of toppling Maharashtra govt: Congress on LPG price hike
51.article_body: All India Mahila Congress on Wednesday, while referring to the price hike of LPG cylinders, asked Centre if it was a cost of toppling the state government in Maharashtra. This comes days after Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde won a confidence vote in the state Assembly. Notably, the price of a 14.2-kg domestic LPG cylinder was increased by ₹50 on Wednesday.

52.title: 17-year-old boy kidnapped, stabbed to death by 4 men in Delhi
52.article_body: Delhi Police have arrested four men for allegedly kidnapping and murdering a 17-year-old over personal enmity on July 1. The accused persons claimed that they were assaulted by the victim and his associates on June 29, following which they murdered him to seek revenge. Police said the accused told them they set the victim's body on fire before burying him.

53.title: 7 injured as vehicle falls into 150-feet deep gorge in J&K's Ramban
53.article_body: Seven people were injured after their vehicle fell into a 150-feet deep gorge in the Ramban district along the Jammu-Srinagar national highway on Wednesday. According to a police official, the driver reportedly lost control of the vehicle following which it skidded off the road and plunged into the gorge. The accident took place near Kharpora village of Banihal, he added.

54.title: OPEC Secretary General Mohammad Barkindo passes away at 63
54.article_body: The Secretary General of the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries, Mohammad Barkindo, passed away at the age of 63 in Nigeria on Tuesday. "His passing is a profound loss to the entire OPEC Family, the oil industry and the international community," OPEC tweeted. Notably, Barkindo was scheduled to step down from the top post at the end of this month.

55.title: Dial 112 to make Teri Galliyan safer: UP Police makes 'Ek..' reference in tweet
55.article_body: The Uttar Pradesh Police took to Twitter to share a tweet about safety while making a reference to the movie 'Ek Villain Returns'. "Be Nobody's #Villaintine...because the only sequel to crime is prison! Dial 112 to make Teri Galliyan safer. #NoVillainReturns," the tweet from the police read. The police also shared a picture with the tweet.

56.title: Amazon agrees to take 2% stake in US meal delivery platform Grubhub
56.article_body: Amazon has agreed to take a stake in Just Eat Takeaway.com's US meal delivery platform Grubhub and will offer its US Prime users a one-year membership to the service. Just Eat Takeaway's shares have fallen 70% this year as shareholders demanded it sold Grubhub or found a partner for it. Amazon will have opportunity to increase the holding to 15%.

57.title: 2 groups clash over social media post on Nupur Sharma in Bihar
57.article_body: A fight broke out reportedly between two groups over a social media post on suspended BJP leader Nupur Sharma in Bihar's Ara on Tuesday. The police reached the spot and detained the persons involved in the scuffle. According to the Ara DM, it was "a matter of a small fight between two youths".

58.title: White-ball captaincy is my priority, needs attention: Buttler on his Test career
58.article_body: England's newly-appointed white-ball captain Jos Buttler has said the question over his Test return doesn't have to be answered unless he's picked in the squad. "I was left out on merit and rightfully so...I'm not part of the team at the moment," stated Buttler. "Being captain of the white-ball team is my number one priority...that needs full-time attention," he added.

59.title: Tree branch falls on Thane civic body's Additional Commissioner's car
59.article_body: A tree branch fell on the car of Thane Municipal Corporation Additional Commissioner Sanjay Herwade on Tuesday amidst heavy rains. Herwade went to the Louiswadi area for inspection when the tree branch fell on his car. However, no one was injured in the incident as Herwade and his driver were out of the vehicle at the time of the incident.

60.title: HC stays bail granted to ex-Cong leader Sajjan Kumar in 1984 riots case
60.article_body: Delhi High Court stayed the order granting bail to former Congress leader Sajjan Kumar in a rioting and murder case in connection with the 1984 riots. HC sought Kumar's response to SIT's petition that challenged the bail. Notably, Kumar is already serving a life sentence in another case arising from the riots following the assassination of former PM Indira Gandhi.

61.title: 35-yr-old spiritual leader Khwaja Sayyad Chishti shot in the head in Maharashtra
61.article_body: Spiritual leader Khwaja Sayyad Chishti, also known as 'Sufi Baba', was shot dead in Maharashtra's Nashik on Tuesday. The 35-year-old was shot in the head and died instantly, and the killers escaped in one of his SUVs, police said. Sayyad Chishti, who was from Afghanistan, had lived in Nashik's Yeola town for several years.

62.title: Shiv Sena wants me to contest Pune Lok Sabha seat: Shivajirao
62.article_body: Former Shirur MP Shivajirao Adhalrao Patil has said that the Shiv Sena has urged him to prepare himself to contest the Pune Lok Sabha seat in the next general election. He was expelled by the Shiv Sena for posting a message congratulating new CM Eknath Shinde last week. However, Shiv Sena withdrew the expulsion order the next day.

63.title: GMDA to use drone surveillance for traffic management in Gurugram
63.article_body: Gurugram Metropolitan Development Authority will start using drone technology for traffic management in Gurugram. The decision came following an increase in number of vehicles flouting norms and issues in traffic management. "The drone will also have a feature where it'll capture the vehicle's registration number plate and send a challan to those violating traffic rules online," an official said.

64.title: Shinde's wife plays drums as he reaches home 1st time after becoming CM
64.article_body: Maharashtra Chief Minister Eknath Shinde's wife Lata Shinde played drums along with other musicians to welcome her husband home as he reached his residence first time after becoming the Chief Minister. In a video shared by news agency ANI, Lata can be seen smiling and playing drums. Several other people behind her can also be seen playing drums.

65.title: We need to prepare for complete cut-off of Russian gas: EU chief
65.article_body: European Commission chief Ursula von der Leyen on Wednesday said that the 27 EU nations need to prepare for further disruption and "even a complete cut-off of Russian gas supply". The statement comes in view of the ongoing war between Russia and Ukraine. Russia has already restricted its gas supplies to some European countries.

66.title: Insult of Hindu deities won't be tolerated: MP CM to Mahua Moitra
66.article_body: Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan criticised TMC MP Mahua Moitra for her "Kaali is a meat-eating and alcohol-accepting goddess" remark and said that she has hurt Hindu religious sentiments. "Insult of Hindu deities will not be tolerated at any cost," Chouhan added. Meanwhile, a case was registered in Bhopal against Moitra for hurting religious sentiments.

67.title: ACB raids PMC official's properties, unearths assets worth ₹1 crore
67.article_body: Pune unit of the Anti-Corruption Bureau (ACB) filed a case of disproportionate assets against Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) official Vijay Bhaskar Landge and his wife on Tuesday after unearthing assets worth ₹1.02 crore. ACB conducted searches in properties linked to Landge in Pune and Nashik. ACB found documents of 5.5-acre agricultural land and other properties owned by Landge.

68.title: Andhra MP, CRPF personnel assault policeman in Hyderabad; booked
68.article_body: Rebel MP of Andhra Pradesh's ruling YSR Congress Party, K Raghu Rama Krishna Raju, his son, his personal assistant and two CRPF personnel were booked for allegedly assaulting a policeman in Hyderabad. The complainant alleged that he was attacked with sticks and forcibly carried in their car while on duty and was illegally confined in Raju's house for three hours.

69.title: Clay recycling campaign to be launched in Pune this Ganesha Chaturthi
69.article_body: In view of the Ganesha Chaturthi festival, several Pune-based organisations have decided to launch a clay recycling campaign in Pune and Pimpri-Chinchwad municipal corporation areas. The clay sludge will be collected in residential societies, drop-off points across the city and at a few selected ghats. The clay will be transported to artists.

70.title: Bring it on BJP, I'm not afraid of police: Mahua on complaints over Goddess Kali remark
70.article_body: After the BJP filed several police complaints against TMC MP Mahua Moitra for her remarks on Goddess Kali, she tweeted, "Bring it on BJP!" Moitra added, "Am a Kali worshipper. I am not afraid of anything. Not your ignoramuses. Not your goons. Not your police. And most certainly not your trolls." She also wrote, "Truth doesn't need back up forces."

71.title: Businessman forces wife to attend wife-swapping parties in Delhi; booked
71.article_body: A Gurugram businessman has been booked for allegedly forcing his wife to attend wife-swapping parties in Delhi. "If I refused...my husband would thrash and sexually abuse me," she alleged. The FIR was registered by UP Police after she approached a Muzaffarnagar court claiming she was intercepted by her husband's goons when she tried to approach Gurugram Police.

72.title: I'm suffering from character blindness: Rajamouli's cousin on Resul's tweet
72.article_body: Reacting to Oscar-winning film sound designer Resul Pookutty calling RRR a 'gay love story', the film's director SS Rajamouli's cousin and music composer MM Keeravaani tweeted, "I [am now suffering]...from character blindness." "I am not able to see [actors Ram Charan] and...[Jr NTR's] characters from RRR anymore (who looked like having shared a special relationship)," he added on Twitter.

73.title: Punjab cabinet approves 300 units of free electricity to every household
73.article_body: The Punjab cabinet on Wednesday approved the decision to provide 300 units of free electricity to every household in the state. Taking to Twitter, CM Bhagwant Mann said, "We had guaranteed the people of Punjab that we will give 300 units electricity free of cost as soon as we form government. This decision has been approved by the cabinet today."

74.title: Water levels of 4 dams supplying water to Pune rise after continuous rains
74.article_body: Water levels of the four dams supplying water to Pune city are slowly rising following continuous rainfall in the catchment areas. The storage in Khadakwasla, Panshet, Varasgaon and Temghar dams has reportedly reached 3.67 thousand million cubic feet (TMC). Last week, due to deficit rainfall, the water storage in the four dams had dropped to 2.5 TMC.

75.title: Daughter said 'Your Spice Girls skirts were too short, unacceptable': Victoria
75.article_body: Singer Victoria Beckham said that her daughter Harper Seven Beckham said that Victoria's skirts during her time with 'Spice Girls' were "unacceptable". "Harper actually said to me recently, 'Mummy, I've seen some pictures of you when you were in the Spice Girls, and your skirts...were just too short.' Then David piped up and said, 'Absolutely, Harper! They really...were'," she added.

76.title: Rishabh Pant can open for Team India in T20Is: Wasim Jaffer
76.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Wasim Jaffer has said the Team India management should think about wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant as an opener in T20Is. "I think that's the spot where Rishabh can blossom," added Jaffer. Pant smashed the fastest Test hundred by an Indian wicketkeeper in the fifth Test against England. He scored 146(111) in the first innings and 57(86) in the second.

77.title: BMC issues advisory amid rising dengue, malaria cases in Mumbai
77.article_body: Amid rising dengue and malaria cases in Mumbai, the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation has issued an advisory requesting citizens to take extra care and not ignore fever. Nearly 40 cases of gastro and malaria have been reported across Mumbai in the first three days of July. Zen Multi Speciality Hospital's Dr Vikrant Shah said, "[Viral] cases are...[rising]...due to sudden changes in...climate."

78.title: Several police complaints filed against Mahua Moitra over her remarks on Goddess Kali
78.article_body: Several police complaints have been filed against TMC MP Mahua Moitra by the BJP across West Bengal over her remarks on Goddess Kali. Moitra had said, "For me, Goddess Kali is a meat-eating and alcohol-accepting goddess." After a controversy erupted over her statement on the goddess, she tweeted, "I never backed any film or poster or mentioned the word smoking."

79.title: SpiceJet issued show cause notice after 8 malfunction incidents in 18 days
79.article_body: Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) has issued a show cause notice to budget carrier SpiceJet after the airline reported eight malfunction incidents in last 18 days. It said that SpiceJet has "failed to establish safe, efficient and reliable air services". The Accountable Manager has been called upon to show cause within three weeks of receipt of the notice.

80.title: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann to marry for the 2nd time tomorrow, pic of wife-to-be surfaces
80.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann will get married to Dr Gurpreet Kaur in a private ceremony in Chandigarh on Thursday. It'll be his second marriage. He was earlier married to Inderpreet Kaur, with whom he got divorced in 2015. Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal is likely to attend the wedding with his family. Bhagwant Mann has two children from his first marriage.

81.title: Was told 'Offer Rajkummar cup of tea, send him away': Hansal on 'Shahid'
81.article_body: Discussing his 2013 film 'Shahid', director Hansal Mehta said, "I wasn't ready to meet [actor Rajkummar Rao]. Anurag Kashyap and [casting director] Mukesh Chhabra told me to...meet him once." Hansal added that Chhabra later called him to inform him that Rajkummar was standing outside his office. "[He told me to]...offer a cup of tea and send Rajkummar away," stated Hansal.

82.title: Shardul is not the same bowler we saw 18 months back: Manjrekar
82.article_body: Cricketer-turned-commentator Sanjay Manjrekar has said all-rounder Shardul Thakur wasn't as effective in the rescheduled fifth Test against England as he was a few months back. "Shardul is not the same bowler we saw in Test cricket maybe 18 months back," stated Manjrekar. Shardul had picked seven wickets in two Tests he played against England last year.

83.title: Delhi govt warns parents against misuse of CCTV footage of classrooms
83.article_body: The Delhi government has warned parents and guardians of children studying in its schools from sharing the CCTV footage of classrooms. Parents have reportedly been asked to take a pledge that they will not share the password of the mobile app used to access the footage. Notably, the project was launched by the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) in 2019.

84.title: Ukrainian Governor urges 3.5 lakh people to flee amid Russian offensive
84.article_body: Governor of Donetsk province, Pavlo Kyrylenko, urged over 3,50,000 residents to evacuate the province to save lives and to enable the Ukrainian army to better defend towns from the Russian onslaught. This comes after Russian forces struck targets across Ukraine's eastern Donetsk region on Tuesday, a day after Russian President Vladimir Putin declared victory in the neighbouring Luhansk province.

85.title: Blast at arms depot in Yemen kills at least 6, injures 32
85.article_body: At least six people were killed and 32 injured after a blast occurred at an arms depot in Yemen's Abyan province on Tuesday, said medical officials. Many of the wounded victims were said to be critical and the officials feared the death toll might rise. The cause of the explosion was not immediately known.

86.title: Minister, lawmaker resign from UK PM Johnson's government after Sunak, Javid's exit
86.article_body: British Minister for Children and Families Will Quince resigned on Wednesday, saying he was going after being given an "inaccurate" briefing over PM Boris Johnson's appointment of a politician who was subject of complaints. Lawmaker Laura Trott also stepped down from her role as Parliamentary Private Secretary to Department of Transport. This comes after Rishi Sunak and Sajid Javid's exit.

87.title: Meta sues individual who scraped data from 3.5 lakh Instagram profiles
87.article_body: Facebook-parent Meta has sued Turkey-based individual, Ekrem Ateş, for using automated Instagram accounts to scrape data from the profiles of over 3.5 lakh Instagram users. The individual later published that data on a series of clone sites. Meta has also sued Octopus, a US subsidiary of a Chinese firm, that offers data scraping-for-hire services to individuals and companies.

88.title: Over 1,100 people died of TB in Pune, Pimpri Chinchwad in last 2 years
88.article_body: According to the health authorities, more than 1,100 people have died of tuberculosis (TB) in the last two years in Pune city and Pimpri Chinchwad. There were 439 and 385 TB-related deaths in Pune in the year 2020 and 2021, respectively. Whereas in Pimpri-Chinchwad, 147 people succumbed to the infectious lung disease in 2020 and 162 died in 2021.

89.title: SC to hear anchor Rohit Ranjan's plea against FIRs over Rahul Gandhi video
89.article_body: Supreme Court on July 7 will hear TV news anchor Rohit Ranjan's plea against multiple FIRs over clips on Rahul Gandhi. "Please list this urgently...otherwise, he'll be in repeated custody," his lawyer told SC. Noida Police arrested Ranjan in connection with clips purportedly misquoting Gandhi and linking his statements on vandalism at his Wayanad office to the Udaipur tailor's murder.

90.title: Final construction on Delhi-Meerut Expressway to be completed in August: Official
90.article_body: The National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) officials said that the rail overbridge, which is the final structure on the Delhi-Meerut Expressway (DME), is expected to be complete by mid-August. We will close down three exits in Vijay Nagar area after construction of the rail overbridge located at Chipyana Bujurg near Crossings Republik is completed, an NHAI official said.

91.title: Man gets ₹60,000 from mobile network operator after number gets blocked in Tamil Nadu
91.article_body: A consumer court has asked a mobile network operator to give ₹60,000 as compensation to a Tamil Nadu man after his number was blocked and allocated to another person without explanation. The court asked the operator to pay ₹25,000 for deficiency in service and ₹30,000 for loss of customer's contacts as well as causing mental agony.

92.title: UDF protests outside Kerala Assembly over minister's remarks on Constitution
92.article_body: The opposition UDF led by Congress on Wednesday held a protest outside Kerala Assembly against state minister Saji Cherian's remarks on the Indian Constitution. "What Cherian said is not acceptable and [CM Pinarayi] Vijayan should ask for his resignation," said VD Satheesan, Leader of Opposition in the Assembly. Notably, Cherian had said that the Constitution exploits working-class people.

93.title: Couldn't take decisions on Dawood Ibrahim, Mumbai blasts in MVA govt: Shinde
93.article_body: Maharashtra Chief Minister Eknath Shinde said, "Shiv Sena, BJP contested 2019 Assembly elections together but...government was formed with Congress and NCP...whenever issues of Hindutva...Savarkar...Mumbai blasts...[and] Dawood came up...we were unable to take a decision." He also said, "We have decided to take our Hindu Hriday Samrat Balasaheb Thackeray's Hindutva ideology further."

94.title: 4 detained for making threat calls to people supporting Nupur Sharma in Amravati
94.article_body: Amravati Police detained four people for making threat calls to people who made social media posts in support of Nupur Sharma. The police also appealed to people to contact the nearest police station if someone threatens them over their posts on Nupur Sharma, said Amravati Police Commissioner Arti Singh. She added the details of the complainant will be kept confidential.

95.title: 37-yr-old man run over by bus after bumping into pothole in Thane
95.article_body: A 37-year-old man was run over by a state bus after his motorcycle bumped into a pothole in Maharashtra's Thane on Tuesday. The incident occurred at Ghodbunder Road when the man lost his balance after hitting the pothole and fell off the motorcycle. The victim was rushed to the hospital where he was declared dead by doctors, reports said.

96.title: 30-day Delhi Shopping Festival will be organised in Jan-Feb 2023: CM
96.article_body: Arvind Kejriwal on Wednesday said that a 30-day Delhi Shopping Festival will be organised from January 28 to February 26, 2023. "Heavy discounts will be offered. Entire Delhi will be decorated. Exhibitions will also be organised," he added. "I expect that in a few years, we will make it the biggest shopping festival in the world," Kejriwal further said.

97.title: Mahua unfollows TMC on Twitter after party condemns her remark on goddess Kaali
97.article_body: TMC leader Mahua Moitra has unfollowed the official Twitter handle of TMC. This comes after the party distanced itself from her remarks on goddess Kaali. "To me, Kaali is a meat-eating and alcohol-accepting goddess," Moitra said. Following her statement, TMC said, "The comments made by [Moitra] and her views…have been made in her personal capacity…AITC strongly condemns such comments."

98.title: India creating ecosystem to make social media accountable: Vaishnaw
98.article_body: Union IT Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw on Tuesday called social media "a very powerful medium" that has a "big influence" on people's lives. "How to make it accountable has become a very valid question," Vaishnaw said. He added, "Everywhere across the globe and even in our country, an ecosystem, a thought process, is being created to make social media accountable."

99.title: Clear buys compliance risk management platform CimplyFive in all-cash deal
99.article_body: Fintech startup Clear, formerly known as ClearTax, has acquired compliance risk management platform CimplyFive in an all-cash deal, which was reportedly worth around ₹75 crore. As per a statement, CimplyFive will continue to run as an independent platform, led by its founder Shankar Jaganathan. Earlier this year, Clear acquired supply-chain financing company Xpedize for around ₹100 crore.

100.title: China-bound SpiceJet cargo plane returns over faulty weather radar, 3rd incident in 24 hrs
100.article_body: SpiceJet said its China-bound cargo plane returned to Kolkata on Tuesday as pilots realised after take-off that its weather radar wasn't working. It was the third incident of technical malfunction on a SpiceJet aircraft in 24 hours. Earlier on Tuesday, a Delhi-Dubai flight made emergency landing in Karachi over malfunctioning fuel indicator and a Kandla-Mumbai flight suffered a windshield crack.

101.title: Hard-fought series, competition was at its best: Jadeja on England Tests
101.article_body: India all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja took to Twitter to share pictures from Edgbaston Test, which India lost by seven wickets. He wrote, "Always a great feeling to contribute for my team, even though we fell short. A hard-fought series where the competition was at its best." Jadeja scored his first overseas hundred in international cricket in the match.

102.title: Sinner had nothing to lose before match but lot to lose 2 sets up: Novak
102.article_body: Following his comeback win after losing the first two sets against Italian tennis player Jannik Sinner in Wimbledon, Novak Djokovic said, "Sinner had nothing to lose before the match, but...lot to lose when...two sets...up." "I could feel that on a mental level...If you're up against...players like Sinner, who...[are playing] their first quarter-final...those things play a role," he added.

103.title: Turning point was India losing 6 wickets for 55 runs in 3rd innings: Deep
103.article_body: Ex-India wicketkeeper-batter Deep Dasgupta said the turning point of the fifth Test between India and England which the former lost by seven wickets, was India losing six wickets within 55 runs in the third innings. "We dominated the match for...first three days...We [could've] batted more carefully...An increase of 100 runs would have...reduced the overs for [the] final innings," added Deep.

104.title: Crypto sector has many business models, some are riskier: CoinSwitch CEO
104.article_body: CoinSwitch Kuber's CEO Ashish Singhal took to Twitter to say, "Crypto industry has several business models. Some are inherently riskier than others and can come undone, as recent events have shown." His statement came after cryptocurrency exchange Vauld suspended trading, deposits and withdrawals citing "financial difficulties". He also discussed CoinSwitch's business model in his tweets.

105.title: Blinken unlikely to hold talks with Russian Foreign Min at G20: US
105.article_body: US State Department spokesman Ned Price said he doesn't expect State Secretary Antony Blinken to meet with Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov at G20 Foreign Ministers' meeting in Bali. Price said he expects G20 members to condemn Russia's invasion of Ukraine. However, Blinken will meet Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi for a "candid exchange" on Beijing’s response to Ukraine war.

106.title: India has to manage its own interests: EAM Jaishankar on Ukraine war
106.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar said that India has taken the "right course" on the Ukraine conflict and added that it is a very complex matter where the most urgent issue is to prevent hostilities from escalating. "We have historical interest, we have a strategic interest, we have current interests and we have to manage those interests," he added.

107.title: Thiruvananthapuram's Lulu mall to begin 'midnight shopping' concept on trial basis
107.article_body: Lulu International Shopping Mall in Kerala's Thiruvananthapuram is set to introduce "midnight shopping" concept, state capital's first night-shopping model, on a trial basis from July 6. "Our main intention is...to ensure that public experience nightlife with less traffic, where they can purchase their daily needs in more peaceful atmosphere," Joy Shadanandan, Regional Director, Lulu group, said.

108.title: Man takes wrong turn using Google Maps in Gurugram, made to sweep road
108.article_body: A man in Gurugram has alleged that a constable made him sweep the road after he took a wrong turn as directed by Google Maps, which took him to a restricted area. "When I stepped out, he abused me," the man said, adding that the constable said he brought mud with tyres of the car. An inquiry has been initiated.

109.title: What is the story behind Joe Root's 'pinky finger' celebration against India?
109.article_body: England's Joe Root celebrated his Edgbaston Test hundred against India by wiggling his pinky finger. It was a reference to a scene from singer Elvis Presley's biopic 'Elvis'. In the movie, Elvis wiggles his little finger despite being ordered by police not to perform his signature movements. Root revealed Ben Stokes watched 'Elvis' and asked the team to be "rockstars".

110.title: Girl shares pics after her cheek was grazed by a bullet during US mass shooting
110.article_body: An 18-year-old girl has shared pictures of her injury after her cheek was grazed by a bullet in the US Independence Day parade mass shooting. "I can't believe I was in the middle of a mass shooting. I'm still in shock. I am so sorry for everyone who lost loved ones," the girl named Lilli said.

111.title: PFI activist arrested for training youth in martial arts in Telangana
111.article_body: A 52-year-old alleged activist of the Popular Front of India (PFI) was arrested in Nizamabad for reportedly training youth and children in martial arts. According to police, the accused, identified as Abdul Khader, was training innocent Muslims against Hindus and organizing physical training camps. Police seized books, bamboo sticks, stationery, teaching board, meeting mic etc from his possession.

112.title: Mumbai witnesses nearly 70% of average July rainfall in 5 days
112.article_body: Amid heavy rains, Mumbai witnessed 69.41% (594 mm) of the average July rainfall (855.7 mm) in the first five days of the month, as per India Meteorological Department (IMD) data. "Due to active monsoon conditions, rainfall activity over Konkan and adjoining ghat areas of Madhya Maharashtra is expected to increase in the next four to five days," IMD stated.

113.title: 3 Khans won't come on 'Koffee..'; I've no power, doomed by reputation: Karan
113.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar said the three Khans will not be coming on the latest season of 'Koffee With Karan'. "I am doomed by the reputation...of my show," he said, adding, "I don't have...power to pull them [three Khans]. I can get them for a party but not on my show. I can't manage two also out of the three Khans."

114.title: 50-yr-old man rapes & impregnates 16-yr-old neighbour in Mumbai; arrested
114.article_body: A 50-year-old man was arrested for allegedly raping his 16-year-old neighbour in Mumbai.  The accused reportedly asked the girl to help him move when he shifted to a new house. Later, he accused her of stealing things from his house and raped her before letting her go home, police said. The matter came to light when the girl became pregnant.

115.title: Cried when Nadal lost vs Djokovic in French Open 2021: Iga Świątek
115.article_body: World number one women's tennis player Iga Świątek said she "cried" after Rafael Nadal's loss against Novak Djokovic in the semi-final of French Open 2021. "Nadal has always been my idol," added Świątek. Talking about picking between singer Adele and Nadal, Świątek stated on Twitter, "I would need to listen to Rafa singing and see Adele playing tennis."

116.title: TMC should expel Moitra if they don't endorse her remark: BJP's Sukanta
116.article_body: West Bengal BJP chief Sukanta Majumdar said that TMC can't detach itself from Mahua Moitra's remark on goddess Kaali. "If TMC actually doesn't endorse it, they should take action and they should either expel her or suspend her from the party for a few days," Majumdar said. On Tuesday, TMC condemned Moitra's "Kaali is a meat-eating and alcohol-accepting goddess" remark.

117.title: Jadeja bowls too flat, India missed a quality spinner: Lloyd on 5th Test
117.article_body: Ex-England cricketer David Lloyd said India were "hamstrung" by not having a quality spinner in the fifth Test against England which they lost by seven wickets, having not picked Ravichandran Ashwin. "[Ravindra Jadeja] tends to bowl too flat and...quick," added Lloyd. "Loop drift and spin bring dividends...Ashwin has it but India played safe-to their cost," he stated.

118.title: US pushes ASML to stop selling chipmaking gear to China: Report
118.article_body: The US is pushing semiconductor manufacturing equipment provider ASML to stop selling any more of its gear to Chinese chipmakers, Bloomberg reported. It's seeking to expand an existing moratorium on advanced chipmaking systems' sales to Chinese firms. "The discussion is not new. No decisions have been made, and we do not want to speculate or comment on rumours," ASML said.

119.title: Canada becomes 1st country to ratify Finland, Sweden's bids to join NATO
119.article_body: Canada became the first country to formally ratify Sweden and Finland's requests to join NATO after member nations signed off on the accession protocols on Tuesday. Parliaments of all 30 NATO members must ratify Finland and Sweden's bids before they can be protected by the NATO defence clause, which states an attack on one ally is an attack against all.

120.title: Instagram Direct down for many users across the globe for over 12 hours
120.article_body: Instagram Direct has been down for many users across the globe for over 12 hours, with users saying they have been unable to send messages. A user took to Twitter and wrote, "Why isn't there any statement on when the issue is going to get resolved?" "It's been 12 hours! How much time it'd need to restore," another user tweeted.

121.title: Important for Team India to have stable captain: Deep Dasgupta
121.article_body: After England levelled the five-match Test series 2-2 with a seven-wicket win over India, former India cricketer Deep Dasgupta said it's important to have a stable captain. "In the last few months...due to injury and other reasons, we had to shuffle between captains," he added. Notably, India captain Rohit Sharma has returned to the squad for England T20Is.

122.title: Biggest proof of honesty: Kejriwal on CAG report showing Delhi govt in profit
122.article_body: Speaking about the CAG report which stated that the Delhi government was running in profit, Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal said that the numbers were the "biggest proof of its honesty". "This honesty has deprived our opponents of their sleep," Kejriwal added. The CAG report indicated that Delhi government's revenue receipts were sufficient to meet the revenue expenditure.

123.title: YSRCP MLA from Nellore enters drain to protest against sewage issues
123.article_body: YSRCP MLA from Nellore, Kotamreddy Sridhar Reddy, protested against the officials for not resolving sewage issues in Umma Reddy Gunta by entering into sewage water on Tuesday. He said officials didn't listen to him despite several requests. He demanded the officials to give him in writing, a proper time frame for the work to be completed.

124.title: Hyderabad woman cheated of ₹39 lakh in 'KBC lottery’ fraud
124.article_body: Cyber fraudsters reportedly cheated a woman from Hyderabad of ₹39 lakh. They called her and said she has won 'KBC lottery' and made her pay ₹39 lakh fees as a part of the withdrawal process. When she realised she was cheated, the woman lodged a complaint. Police tracked the accused and arrested a man involved in the fraud from Patna.

125.title: British & their habit of distorting history: Mishra on Barmy Army's 'Eng win series' pic
125.article_body: Veteran leg-spinner Amit Mishra took to Twitter to criticise England's Barmy Army after they posted a picture that read, "England win series 1-0", following the fifth Test at Edgbaston. "Haash! British and their habit of distorting history for their own advantage," Mishra wrote. The series ended 2-2, with India having earlier taken a 2-1 lead after the first four matches.

126.title: US Independence Day parade shooter was dressed as a woman; pic surfaces
126.article_body: The shooter, who killed seven people at an Independence Day parade in US, dressed as a woman so that he could escape the scene of the mass shooting. Robert Crimo was arrested on Monday evening following an eight-hour manhunt and was charged with seven counts of first-degree murder on Tuesday. He was carrying an AR-15-style rifle.

127.title: I'd rather do films I'm proud of, okay if they don't make ₹100 cr: Rajkummar
127.article_body: Actor Rajkummar Rao said that it is okay if his films do not make ₹100 crore at the box office. "I [would] rather do films I can be proud of and not necessarily something that is working. As long as my producers don't lose money, I can keep telling stories...I don't want to be part of a herd," he added.

128.title: Man electrocuted to death in Kolkata; 3rd such incident in past 2 weeks
128.article_body: A 35-year-old man was electrocuted to death in Kolkata's Tangra area on Tuesday. According to reports, a minor fire broke out at Bunty Haldar's shop at around 9 am. However, when he tried to pull down the shop's iron shutter, he was electrocuted, police said. Notably, this is the third such incident in Kolkata in the past two weeks.

129.title: Bar body urges CJI to reject plea against SC remarks on Nupur
129.article_body: All India Bar Association wrote to CJI NV Ramana asking him to reject a letter petition seeking removal of Supreme Court’s recent remarks against suspended BJP leader Nupur Sharma. “While engaging with counsel, it is natural for judges to open up and make observations and suggestions,” said AIBA. This comes after several former judges and bureaucrats condemned the court's remarks.

130.title: RBI to release Code of Conduct for digital lending by July-end: Report
130.article_body: The Reserve Bank of India will release the Code of Conduct for digital lending by the end of this month, ET Now reported citing sources. The guidelines will be applicable to all regulated entities including NBFCs and banks. Consumer consent will become mandatory for using data collected from users, the report added.

131.title: We're not doing anything illegal, ours is strong govt: Maha CM Shinde
131.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde on Wednesday said, "We are not doing anything illegal." "There are rules, laws and Constitution and we've to work according to them," he added. Furthermore, he said, "Today, we've more than a 2/3rd majority, so our decision is legal." Shinde added, his government has the support of 170 MLAs and it’s a strong government.

132.title: Woman killed in landslide in Shimla, 4 feared washed away after flash flood in Kullu
132.article_body: A landslide on the outskirts of Shimla city left a woman dead and two others critically injured, an official said. At least four people were feared washed away in a flash flood triggered by a cloud burst in Himachal Pradesh's Kullu district. Following the cloud burst at Chojh village at around 6 am, four to six people were missing.

133.title: Will not share US user data with China if asked: TikTok
133.article_body: TikTok in response to two US senators seeking an FTC probe into it due to "repeated misrepresentations" over its handling of US data, said, "TikTok has never shared US user data with the Chinese government, nor would we if asked." The senators' request followed a BuzzFeed report saying TikTok engineers and executives in China repeatedly access US users' private data.

134.title: Hyderabad civic body to build more than 35,000 2BHKs by March 2023
134.article_body: Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) has decided to complete the construction of 35,444 2BHKs by March 2023 under the Telangana government's double-bedroom housing scheme. Urban Development Minister KT Rama Rao has instructed officials to formulate an action plan within a week for the distribution of the houses. Notably, the construction of 64,556 units has already been completed.

135.title: Mumbai man who abused police for waking him gets 1.7 yrs in jail
135.article_body: A  27-year-old labourer who abused a police constable when woken up at Chhatrapati Shivaji Terminus' platform was sentenced to one year and seven months' imprisonment by a sessions court. Refusing to leave the platform, Panvel resident Rameshwar Rathoda abused the police and said, "Does this platform belong to your father...I will sleep here if I want to...Do whatever you want."

136.title: HC dismisses plea over property acquisition filed after delay of 62 yrs
136.article_body: Delhi HC dismissed a plea in connection with acquisition of property in Kalu Sarai after noting it was filed after a delay of 62 years. The plea sought dismissal of notifications of 1959 and 1960 issued under Land Acquisition Act, 1894. "Petitioners accepted...enhanced compensation without reserving any right...the law doesn't permit...to approbate and reprobate at the same time," HC said.

137.title: Suspect in US parade shooting charged with 7 counts of murder
137.article_body: A 21-year-old man accused of opening fire on US Independence Day parade in a Chicago suburb has been charged with seven counts of murder. The first-degree murder charges would be followed by "dozens of more charges", Lake County State Attorney Eric Rinehart said. The accused, who'd reportedly fired 70 rounds into the crowd, planned the attack for weeks, police said.

138.title: PM Modi calls up Tejashwi Yadav to enquire about Lalu Prasad Yadav's health
138.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi spoke to Rashtriya Janata Dal leader Tejashwi Yadav to enquire about health of RJD chief Lalu Prasad Yadav, who fractured his shoulder after falling off stairs on Sunday. "The PM spoke to Tejashwi Yadav on Tuesday and enquired about the health of the RJD supremo. PM wished speedy recovery to RJD chief," RJD spokesperson (Bihar), said.

139.title: BJP filled with terrorists, it's top 2 afraid of AAP: Kejriwal
139.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal called BJP a party "filled with gundas, hooligans, rapists and terrorists". He noted that a terrorist recently arrested in Jammu and Kashmir was a "senior leader". "If you google 'rapist in BJP', you will find a long list of BJP leaders," he said. He also said that BJP's top two leaders are afraid of AAP.

140.title: Edtech startup AntWalk secures $7.5 million funding in Series A round
140.article_body: Bengaluru-based B2B edtech startup AntWalk has secured $7.5 million funding in a Series A round led by San Francisco-based venture capital firm GSV Ventures. Y Combinator and existing investor Matrix Partners India also participated in the round. The startup, which was founded in 2019, will use the newly-acquired funding to expand its customer base, among other things.

141.title: 5 Assamese-speaking Muslim groups get indigenous status in Assam
141.article_body: Assam cabinet granted indigenous status to five Assamese-speaking Muslim communities. "They are Goria, Moriya, Deshi, Julah and Syed...they will be categorised as Assamese Muslim sub-groups or indigenous Assamese Muslims," state Health Minister Keshab Mahanta said. This will ensure their development in health, education, skill development and women empowerment, CM Himanta Biswa Sarma said.

142.title: Not Bazball, it's what they normally do: Hussain on Root-Bairstow's stand
142.article_body: Talking about the unbeaten 269-run partnership between Joe Root and Jonny Bairstow in England's second innings of the fifth Test against India, ex-England captain Nasser Hussain said, "It's not really Bazball." "The way they...[played] is...what normal Root and Bairstow can do," added Hussain. Root scored an unbeaten 142 with Bairstow remaining unbeaten on 114, as England won by seven wickets.

143.title: India sees 16,159 new COVID-19 cases, 28 deaths; state-wise list of active cases released
143.article_body: India has reported 16,159 new COVID-19 cases and 28 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. India's active caseload stands at 1,15,212, with the maximum active cases in Kerala (29,155), followed by Maharashtra (20,820) and Tamil Nadu (16,765). India's COVID-19 death toll reached 5,25,270.

144.title: Part of me wanted India to get to 450 to see what we'd do: Stokes
144.article_body: After England recorded their highest-ever successful Test chase (378 runs), England captain Ben Stokes said he wanted India to set a target of 450 runs to see what they would do. "We knew we were always going to go out and try and chase that down," he added. England's Joe Root and Jonny Bairstow scored centuries in the fourth innings.

145.title: Female model from Brazil killed while fighting against Russia in Ukraine
145.article_body: A female model from Brazil, who received sniper training, has been killed while fighting against Russia in Ukraine. Thalita do Valle, who was killed in a Russian missile strike, took part in humanitarian missions around the world and had previously fought against ISIS in Iraq. The 39-year-old's brother described her as a hero.

146.title: England Cricket, Barmy Army troll Kohli after England's record run chase against India
146.article_body: England Cricket and Barmy Army trolled Virat Kohli after England recorded their highest successful Test run chase against India. England Cricket shared a picture of Kohli sledging Jonny Bairstow and a picture of seemingly disappointed Kohli embracing Bairstow after India's defeat. Barmy Army tweeted, "Bairstow has scored more runs in...last 25 days than Kohli has in the last 18 months."

147.title: I train everyday to play matches of this calibre: Jannik after match vs Djokovic
147.article_body: World number 13 Jannik Sinner, who had gone two sets up before losing to Novak Djokovic in their Wimbledon 2022 quarter-final, has said he's happy with his performance in the tournament. "I train every day to play matches of this calibre. I know I still have a lot to improve...[but] I think...I showed a good level of tennis," he stated.

148.title: Fewer judges, absence of infra increasing pendency of cases: CJI
148.article_body: Chief Justice of India (CJI) NV Ramana said that pendency of cases is "intensifying" in India due to absence of adequate infrastructure and sufficient number of judges with the increasing workload. He said that he has been reminding the government to expedite the process of filling up vacancies. "I am hoping for some forward movement in this regard," he added.

149.title: Canada to throw out 1.36 crore AstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccine doses
149.article_body: Canada will throw out around 1.36 crore doses of the Oxford-AstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccine that have expired. "Due to limited demand for the vaccine and recipient country challenges with distribution and absorption, they were not accepted," said Health Canada in a statement. The country had procured 2 crore doses from AstraZeneca, but later focused on using Pfizer-BioNTech and Moderna vaccines.

150.title: Aamir is not Punjabi, could have done better with accent in 'Laal...': Sargun
150.article_body: Actress Sargun Mehta said actor Aamir Khan is not Punjabi and he could have done better with Punjabi accent in 'Laal Singh Chaddha'. "Whatever he has done in the film, it takes a lot to get the results. He has...worked really hard," she said, adding, "If Aamir would have [used] pure Punjabi...nobody could have understood."

151.title: We'll fight for it, protest & go to court: AIMIM leader on renaming of Aurangabad
151.article_body: Days after Maharashtra Cabinet approved renaming of Aurangabad to Sambhaji Nagar, AIMIM leader Imtiaz Jaleel on Tuesday said the residents, whichever religion they may be from, feel connected to the name. "No one wants the name to change. We'll fight for it in any way possible...stage protests, go to court and raise our voice in Parliament," he added.

152.title: TV news anchor Rohit Ranjan granted bail over misleading video on Rahul Gandhi
152.article_body: TV news anchor Rohit Ranjan, who was arrested by Noida Police on Tuesday over misleading clips on Congress leader Rahul Gandhi, was released on bail. He was released on bail as the sections against him are bailable offences, police said. Ranjan had purportedly misquoted Gandhi's statements on vandalism at his Wayanad office and linked it to the Udaipur tailor's murder.

153.title: Ajmer Dargah Khadim offers his house to anyone who beheads Nupur Sharma, arrested
153.article_body: Salman Chishti, Khadim of Ajmer Dargah, who announced to give away his house and property in a video to reward anyone who beheads former BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma for her comments against the Prophet has been arrested. Police said that Salman Chishti is a history-sheeter and it was found that he made the video in an inebriated state.

154.title: Russia passes bill for stricter fines on foreign tech firms with no office
154.article_body: Russian lawmakers have passed a bill for stricter penalties for foreign internet companies that fail to open an office in Russia, including fines. Last year, Russian communications regulator Roskomnadzor listed 13 companies, mostly based in the US, required to set up offices by the end of the year. Russia has recently acted against several tech firms, including Meta and Twitter.

155.title: BJP supported us for our 'Hindutva position', development agenda: Maha CM
155.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde has said that the Shiv Sena MLAs who revolted against Uddhav Thackeray's government had taken a "Hindutva position". Shinde said BJP supported them for their Hindutva and agenda of development. "And they (BJP) supported us despite having more numbers, more MLAs," Shinde told ANI, adding that Devendra Fadnavis became Deputy Chief Minister showing a "big heart".

156.title: Eknath Shinde backstabbed me: Former Maha CM Uddhav Thackeray
156.article_body: Former Maharashtra Chief Minister Uddhav Thackeray on Tuesday said Eknath Shinde, who led the rebellion with party MLAs to bring down Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA) government, backstabbed him. "Shinde to whom I have given the responsibility of the party backstabbed me," Thackeray said. "It's painful to see...those who won due to Sena workers and got everything have left," he added.

157.title: BJP planning to convert Delhi into full UT, scrap polls: Kejriwal
157.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Tuesday said there are "talks" that the Centre may dissolve Delhi Assembly and convert Delhi into a full Union Territory (UT). "The BJP leaders are now threatening that there will be no next election in Delhi...by making Delhi a full Union Territory (UT)," Kejriwal said. "By hating Kejriwal, you've started hating the country," he added.

158.title: Skills can take you places: Scaler
158.article_body: Edtech startup, Scaler, highlights the importance of building real skills to take a leap in one's tech career. A structured curriculum, taught by industry experts, prepares engineers for tech roles at top companies, said Scaler. Learners get solid career advice on how to create an impact in the tech world, from mentors who've been there, it added.

159.title: UK signs 1st international data sharing deal post Brexit
159.article_body: UK has entered into an agreement with South Korea under which organisations of both the countries will be able to share data across the borders without restrictions, the government said. This is UK's first international data adequacy agreement post Brexit. UK Data Minister Julia Lopez said, "[It] will enable more vital research that can improve the lives of people."

160.title: 15-year-old missing boy found murdered in Pune; 3 minors arrested
160.article_body: A 15-year-old boy was found murdered on Tuesday in Pune, a day after he went missing. As per police, the victim and five other minors had gathered in Moshi for a party on Monday. During the party, they'd heated arguments which allegedly led to the murder. Three minors have been arrested and they've confessed to the killing, the police said.

161.title: Man who said 'Jesus is supreme' gets death sentence for blasphemy in Pak
161.article_body: A Christian mechanic who said, "Jesus is supreme" during an argument with a customer was handed a death sentence in Pakistan. The man, Ashfaq Masih, was booked and arrested in 2017 after he refused to give a discount to the customer for his services. The crowd, which gathered after the argument broke out, accused Masih of disrespecting Prophet Muhammad.

162.title: When will you ask police to issue lookout notice for Mahua?: BJP MLA to Mamata
162.article_body: Following TMC's Mahua Moitra's remark that to her, "Kaali is a meat-eating and alcohol-accepting goddess", BJP MLA Suvendu Adhikari asked, "Honourable CM Mamata Banerjee, when will you ask Kolkata Police to issue lookout notice for Mahua Moitra for insulting goddess maa Kaali?" "Why do you and your party leaders reserve all the abusive remarks for Hindu deities?" he asked.

163.title: E-challan helps Mumbai woman find bag she left in autorickshaw
163.article_body: A 61-year-old Mumbai-based woman, who left a bag containing valuables worth ₹5 lakh in an autorickshaw, found it back with help of e-challan. She got off at her destination in hurry due to heavy rain. Realising that she left the bag in autorickshaw she rushed to RCF Police Station where the police detected the vehicle number with help of e-challan.

164.title: Reports claim Dhaakad producer sold office to repay loans, he says 'Absolutely wrong'
164.article_body: Kangana Ranaut-starrer Dhaakad's producer Deepak Mukut has rubbished reports that claimed that he sold his office to repay dues and loans because the film failed at the box office. Mukut clarified, "These are baseless rumours and absolutely wrong. I have already recovered maximum loss and whatever is left will be recovered in the due course."

165.title: Difficult for Vihari, Sarfaraz is waiting: Jaffer on changes in Test squad
165.article_body: Former India cricketer Wasim Jaffer has called for Ranji Trophy 2022 top-scorer Sarfaraz Khan's inclusion in India's Test squad in place of Hanuma Vihari, who scored a total of 31 runs in the rescheduled fifth Test against England. "Sarfaraz has been in really good form in the Ranji Trophy and should be given an opportunity," stated Jaffer.

166.title: Domestic LPG cylinder rate increased by ₹50 from today
166.article_body: The price of a 14.2-kg domestic LPG cylinder has been increased by ₹50 with effect from Wednesday, July 6. A domestic LPG cylinder will now cost ₹1,053 in Delhi and ₹1,052.50 in Mumbai. The price of a 5-kg domestic cylinder was also increased by ₹18, however, the price of a 19-kg commercial cylinder was cut by ₹8.50.

167.title: Nadhim Zahawi made UK Finance Minister after Rishi Sunak resigns
167.article_body: Nadhim Zahawi has been appointed as UK Finance Minister after Rishi Sunak resigned from the post. Sunak said that his approach to running the economy was "fundamentally too different" from PM Boris Johnson's. Meanwhile, Steve Barclay has been appointed Health Secretary after resignation of Sajid Javid, who said he had lost confidence in Johnson's ability to govern in national interest.

168.title: Transported to 1947, couldn't believe we recreated Partition: 'Ms..' director
168.article_body: 'Ms Marvel' director Sharmeen Obaid-Chinoy said that there were close to 1,000 extras on the set in the scene about the 1947 Partition. "There was a moment when all of us on set couldn't believe that we were able to recreate Partition...For that time we were filming her walking through that platform, we...really were transported into 1947," she added.

169.title: Relationships in Bollywood are 'very seasonal': Karan Johar
169.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar said relationships in Bollywood are "very seasonal" based on work commitments, adding that people fall off the radar but want to jump back "very conveniently". "I don't believe in seasonal relationships," he stated. Talking about his show 'Koffee with Karan', Karan said there were times when he was "perplexed" and "shocked" about his guests being very boring.

170.title: Justify decision to register Binance unit: French MEP to regulator
170.article_body: French MEP Aurore Lalucq has asked the market regulator to justify its "incomprehensible" decision to register a Binance unit as a digital assets service provider. Lalucq cited a Reuters investigation into money laundering on the platform as a basis for her concerns. She also mentioned Britain's financial regulator said Binance was "not capable of being effectively supervised".

171.title: Laid-off Tesla US workers file plea, allege small severance pay
171.article_body: Two laid-off Tesla US workers have filed an emergency motion alleging far less severance than legally required. The workers were among more than 500 workers laid off in Nevada. The motion stated that Tesla has been asking employees to agree to release it of all claims, in exchange for severance of just one or two weeks' pay and benefits.

172.title: 35-yr-old religious leader from Afghanistan shot dead in Nashik
172.article_body: A 35-year-old religious leader from Afghanistan was shot dead in the Yeola town of Maharashtra's Nashik on Tuesday, said police. A group of four unidentified persons carried out the deed, the motive of which was not immediately known, at an open plot. The victim, identified as Khwaja Sayyad Chishti, was popularly known as 'Sufi Baba' in the town.

173.title: NIA questions Bihar man in Hyderabad over Udaipur tailor's murder
173.article_body: National Investigation Agency (NIA) on Tuesday questioned a 36-year-old man from Bihar living in Hyderabad's Kalandar Nagar in connection with beheading of a tailor, Kanhaiya Lal, in Rajasthan's Udaipur.
