The man was reportedly served a notice by NIA to appear for enquiry in Jaipur on July 14. Lal was murdered by two men for supporting suspended BJP leader Nupur Sharma.

174.title: 2-yr-old boy found wandering alone at US shooting site after both parents killed
174.article_body: A two-year-old boy was found wandering alone after the mass shooting at a US Independence Day parade in Chicago. The parents of the child named Aiden McCarthy were among seven people killed in the massacre, police officials said. The child's image from the shooting site surfaced on social media before police handed him over to his grandparents.

175.title: We have to reflect why we aren't able to bat well in 3rd innings: Dravid
175.article_body: India head coach Rahul Dravid has said they will review the failure of batters in the third innings of recent overseas Test matches. "We have to reflect why we aren't able to bat well in the third innings...and why we aren't able to take 10 wickets in the fourth innings," he stated. India have lost their last three overseas Tests.

176.title: 4 held for killing 17-yr-old boy, burying body in Delhi's Central Ridge
176.article_body: At least four men were arrested for allegedly kidnapping a 17-year-old boy, stabbing him to death and burying his body in Delhi's Central Ridge, police said. The accused burned the victim's and their own clothes to avoid identification and arrest, police added. The victim and his friends had allegedly assaulted one of the four accused on June 29, police stated.

177.title: Won't do sports films as I'm almost forgetting I'm an actor: Taapsee
177.article_body: Taapsee Pannu said she has decided not to act in sports films because she is almost forgetting that she is an actress. "[I've] done so many back-to-back sports films...People keep approaching me for sports biopics," added Taapsee. Taapsee will be next seen in her upcoming film 'Shabaash Mithu' which is a biopic on ex-Indian women's cricket team captain Mithali Raj.

178.title: Cell therapy cancer treatment facility being set up in B'luru, trials on
178.article_body: A cell therapy facility for cancer treatment is being set up in Mazumdar Shaw Medical Centre at Narayana Hrudayalaya Health City in Bengaluru. The team working on it is reportedly trying to bring down cost of the therapy from the current $4,00,000 to $3,50,000. "The clinical trial has already started, and we have dosed several patients," Dr Siddhartha Mukherjee said.

179.title: Delhi to get moderate rainfall on Thursday, 'orange' alert issued
179.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued an 'orange' alert in Delhi for Thursday with the possibility of moderate rainfall. Thursday's rainfall is expected to bring a drop in the maximum temperature by three to four degrees, IMD scientist RK Jenamani said. According to IMD's seven-day forecast, Delhi has a 'yellow' alert for rainfall activity each day till July 11.

180.title: Worker kidnaps employer’s son over non-payment of wages; arrested in Thane
180.article_body: Panvel Police arrested a 35-year-old labourer from Thane's Bhiwandi for allegedly kidnapping his employer's 11-year-old son over non-payment of his wages of ₹8,000. The accused had reportedly demanded a ransom of ₹30,000 from his employer. "With [him], I had an understanding that after...completion of the work, I would pay his wages...Yet, he decided to abduct my son," the employer said.

181.title: B'luru reports 775 new COVID-19 cases; active cases stand at 5,988
181.article_body: Bengaluru reported 775 new COVID-19 cases on Tuesday, taking the number of active cases in the city to 5,988, according to Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike figures. No new coronavirus-related deaths were reported in Bengaluru in the last 24 hours and the positivity rate is at 5.08%, the data showed. The number of active clusters in the city is currently 28.

182.title: Potential Omicron sub-variant of COVID-19 reported from India & 10 countries: WHO
182.article_body: There has been an emergence of a potential Omicron sub-variant referred to as BA.2.75, first reported from India and then from 10 other countries, said the WHO. This sub-variant seems to have a few mutations on the receptor-binding domain of the spike protein, the WHO added. It's too early to know if this sub-variant is clinically more severe, it added.

183.title: What is the new cricketing term 'Bazball'?
183.article_body: The term 'Bazball' is named after England head coach Brendon McCullum. It essentially means an aggressive approach towards scoring quick runs even in Test cricket. 'Bazball' is designed to entertain and try to win matches and not draw them. England chased down targets of 277, 299 and 296 in 78.5, 50 and 54.2 overs, respectively against New Zealand.

184.title: I don't know what it is: Rahul Dravid as reporter asks 'What is your take on Bazball?'
184.article_body: After a reporter asked him about his take on 'Bazball', Team India head coach Rahul Dravid said, "I don't know what it is." Further talking about England's approach in Test cricket, Dravid said, "I'd definitely say the kind of cricket they have been playing in the last few months has been really good. They have been really good at chasing."

185.title: IAF gets 7.5 lakh applications under Agnipath, closes registration
185.article_body: The Indian Air Force (IAF) said it has received nearly 7.5 lakh applications for recruitment under the Agnipath scheme. The registrations, which started on June 24, were closed on Tuesday. "Compared to 6,31,528 applications in the past, which was the highest in any recruitment cycle, this time 7,49,899 applications have been received," said IAF.

186.title: Ola may lay off 400-500 employees to cut costs: Report
186.article_body: Ola is looking at cutting its costs which could result in it laying off around 400-500 employees, Moneycontrol reported citing sources. "Key managers were asked to draw up a list of people from their respective teams last week who can be let go," a source was quoted as saying. It has also stopped investments in overseas markets where it's present.

187.title: 5th electric bus depot started in Pune, 28 charging points operational
187.article_body: The Pune Mahanagar Parivahan Mahamandal Limited (PMPML) has started its fifth e-depot for charging and maintenance of e-buses in the city. The new depot has been started at the Pune Railway Station. Reports said that 25 buses will be charged at this e-depot in the first phase and that 28 charging points are already operational.

188.title: 892 prisoners released on parole across Maha during COVID didn’t return
188.article_body: As many as 892 prisoners of the 4,241 convicts lodged across 46 prisons in Maharashtra, who were released on COVID emergency parole, have reportedly not returned to jail. Many of these prisoners have been convicted of various serious crimes, like murder, attempt to murder etc. Prison department has lodged 86 FIRs against such absconding criminals and police are hunting them.

189.title: Canada museum apologises after India's statement on poster showing goddess Kali smoking
189.article_body: After Indian High Commission in Canada's statement on poster showing goddess Kali smoking, the Aga Khan Museum on Tuesday apologised. "The museum deeply regrets that one of the 18 short videos from 'Under the Tent' and its accompanying social media post have inadvertently caused offence to members of the Hindu and other faith communities," the museum's statement read.

190.title: 2 men drown in water-filled quarry in Mumbai's Dahisar, 1 body recovered
190.article_body: Two men drowned in a water-filled quarry in Mumbai's Dahisar on Tuesday evening. While the body of a 19-year-old youth has been found and identified, the authorities are still searching for the other person. According to police, a group of seven young men had entered the quarry at around 5:30 pm on Tuesday when the two of them drowned.

191.title: PMC yet to recover ₹9.20 cr fine for 92,126 illegal hoardings across Pune
191.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation is yet to recover ₹9.20 crore fine from violators for putting up illegal banners and hoardings across city from April 1, 2021 to June 30, 2022. Officials said fine for 92,126 boards has not been collected. PMC can, according to BPMC Act, recover ₹50,000 from an illegal advertisement board and impose fine of ₹5,000 per illegal hoarding.

192.title: 6-year-old boy falls into water-filled lift duct in Thane, dies
192.article_body: A six-year-old boy died after falling into a water-filled lift duct in an under-construction building in Thane's Dombivali on Tuesday, a police official said. The boy, identified as Vedant Jadhav, had gone missing at around 11:30 am. An investigation revealed that he fell into the duct while trying to retrieve the ball with which he was playing, the official added.

193.title: Nanded-Pune Daily Express train commences operation
193.article_body: The South Central Railway's Nanded-Pune Daily Express train has commenced operations. Raosaheb Patil Danve, Minister of State of Railways and Coal and Mines, flagged off the inaugural service from Jalna railway station on July 4. The train, which will start and terminate in Pune, will cover a distance of approximately 650 km in 14 hours and have 11 stoppages.

194.title: Iran has added unrelated demands for nuclear deal: US Special Envoy
194.article_body: Iran has added demands that have "nothing to do with the nuclear deal", US envoy appointed to revive the 2015 nuclear deal said. Special envoy Robert Malley also said that Iran has made significant progress in Uranium enrichment. Iran was offered relaxations in sanctions if it returned into compliance of the 2015 deal within a provided timeline, he added.

195.title: BharatPe disburses over ₹3,600 crore loans in Q1 FY23, up 112% QoQ
195.article_body: BharatPe on Tuesday said it disbursed over ₹3,600 crore loans to more than 1.2 lakh merchants in Q1 FY23. While disbursements recorded 112% quarter-on-quarter growth, the merchant beneficiary count grew nearly 82% from the January-March quarter, it stated. BharatPe also said that its annualised total payment value (TPV) hit an all-time high of $18.5 billion, an over 50% QoQ rise.

196.title: Complete pending tasks to decongest 77 traffic corridors: Delhi LG
196.article_body: Delhi Lieutenant Governor VK Saxena has told all concerned agencies to complete their pending tasks so as to decongest 77 traffic corridors and improve traffic flow in the national capital. Agencies including the PWD and DDA have been given three months to complete all the pending work. The LG also asked the Chief Secretary to sort all pending departmental issues.

197.title: Chargesheet filed against suspended IAS officer in MNREGA scam
197.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate has filed a chargesheet against suspended IAS officer Pooja Singhal who was arrested for allegedly embezzling MGNREGA funds in Khunti district of Jharkhand. Singhal was arrested on May 11 and her bail hearing is on July 12. The ED has reportedly recovered nearly ₹20 crore from Singhal.

198.title: China sees record rain, extreme heat in June
198.article_body: China is witnessing extreme weather patterns, recording above average rain and heat levels in the same month. This year, northeastern provinces received their highest-ever rainfall recorded in June. The national rainfall average for June was 112.1 mm, 9.1% higher than last year. Contrastingly, the average temperature nationwide was 21.3°C this month, 0.9°C higher than the same period last year.

199.title: India, Iran discuss Chabahar Port progress, situation in Afghanistan
199.article_body: India's Foreign Secretary Vinay Kwatra and Iran's Deputy PM for Political Affairs Dr Ali Bagheri Kani held a telephonic discussion on Tuesday and reviewed the progress of the Chabahar Port. The two sides also discussed the situation in Afghanistan and deliberated on other regional and global issues. Various elements of the India-Iran bilateral relations were discussed, the MEA said.

200.title: Mithun Chakraborty should apologise to Mamata Banerjee: TMC leader
200.article_body: TMC leader Kunal Ghosh criticised actor and BJP leader Mithun Chakraborty and asked him to apologise to West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee. "When Didi nominated him for Rajya Sabha, he said that he will never forget the gesture of Mamata Banerjee. Then he...backstabbed Didi," Ghosh said. Ghosh's comment came after the BJP leader's visit to Kolkata after a year.

201.title: 25-yr-old Army jawan drowns while bathing in river Ganga in U'khand
201.article_body: Police said that a 25-year-old Army jawan, Nitul Yadav, drowned while bathing in river Ganga near Uttarakhand's Rishikesh on Tuesday. Yadav was part of a group of six members who had gone to bathe in the river near Lakshman Jhoola, they added. Suddenly, water levels rose and he was swept away by the strong currents, police said.

202.title: Number of transgender voters rise in Thane municipal polls
202.article_body: The number of transgender voters registered with the Thane Municipal Corporation has increased by over six-times, according to data released by the civic body. In 2017, there were 15 transgender voters, which has now increased to 108. The Thane civic polls will be held later this year. Overall, 13.9 lakh ballots are expected to be cast.

203.title: Norwegian oil and gas workers go on strike amid gas shortage
203.article_body: Amid the shortage of Russian gas in Europe due to the conflict in Ukraine, Norwegian oil and gas workers went on a strike on Tuesday, the Lederne union confirmed. Workers are demanding pay raise to compensate for rising inflation. Norway's largest gas producer, Equinor, on Tuesday confirmed it had initiated a shutdown of three oil fields due to the strike.

204.title: UK's Finance Minister Rishi Sunak resigns citing Boris Johnson's leadership
204.article_body: The UK's Finance Minister Rishi Sunak, along with Health Secretary Sajid Javid, tendered his resignation on Tuesday, citing Prime Minister Boris Johnson's leadership. "I recognise this may be my last ministerial job, but I believe these standards are worth fighting for," Sunak said. Meanwhile, Javid said that he can no longer continue to serve his role in good conscience.

205.title: I'm not admitted to hospital, I'm fine: Shruti on rumours about her health
205.article_body: Actress Shruti Haasan shared a video on Instagram, dismissing all speculations regarding her health issues with PCOS. She said, "Just wanted to clarify...I am [not] unwell...I've realised..some media outlets have blown it way out of proportion." "I also got calls today asking if I am admitted to the hospital, which I am clearly not. I'm doing perfectly fine," she added.

206.title: CAA will be implemented before 2024 Lok Sabha polls: WB BJP chief
206.article_body: West Bengal BJP chief Sukanta Majumdar on Tuesday said that the Citizenship (Amendment) Act or CAA will be implemented before the 2024 Lok Sabha elections. "BJP has a track record of keeping its promises," Sukanta Majumdar said. "We had promised to build Ram Mandir, we have done it. CAA is our goal and we will achieve it," he added.

207.title: Autorickshaw outpaced Mercedes car: Maha CM Shinde on Uddhav
207.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde on Tuesday took a jibe at Shiv Sena president Uddhav Thackeray and said that an autorickshaw has outpaced a Mercedes car. Shinde, whose rebellion led to the downfall of the MVA government in Maharashtra, was referred to as an "autorickshaw driver" by some Sena leaders when he was leading the revolt.

208.title: Israel PM to convey country's stance on Iran nuclear talks to France
208.article_body: Israeli PM Yair Lapid on Tuesday left for France where he said he will convey Israel's position regarding the current nuclear talks, between Iran and world powers, to the French President. "It's important our voice be heard...against this dangerous deal," Lapid told reporters. "We don't oppose a deal. We seek a very strong deal," an aide of Lapid said.

209.title: It bothers me, I don't like injustice: David Warner's wife on his lifetime leadership ban
209.article_body: Australia opener David Warner's wife Candice Warner said the lifetime leadership ban imposed on her husband by Cricket Australia for his role in ball-tampering scandal still bothers her. "I don't like injustice...so it does bother me," she stated. Candice stated, "It doesn't really bother him because he can go and captain in UAE, he can go and captain in India."

210.title: Russian lower house passes bills on war economy measures
210.article_body: Amid the conflict in Ukraine, the Russian parliament's lower house on Tuesday passed two bills, one of which would allow the government to compel businesses to provide goods to the military. The second bill would authorise the government to regulate working hours in such companies. Workers could be compelled to work at night, on weekends, and without annual leave.

211.title: Vote against annual reporting on harassment: Tesla Board to shareholders
211.article_body: Tesla's Board of Directors has recommended shareholders to vote against a proposal regarding annual reporting on anti-harassment and discrimination efforts taken by the company for its employees, as per a US SEC filing. The Board's existing policies "effectively address" the issues, the document said. Tesla is facing 10 lawsuits alleging racial discrimination or sexual harassment in the US.

212.title: Haryana has become stronghold of criminals: Cong's Hooda
212.article_body: The law and order situation in Haryana has completely collapsed under the BJP-JJP government and the state has become a stronghold of criminals, Congress leader Bhupinder Singh Hooda said on Tuesday. No one is safe in the state, neither the common man nor an MLA, he said. He added that three MLAs have received threats within a week.

213.title: Rihanna becomes youngest self-made billionaire woman in US at 34
213.article_body: Rihanna has become the youngest self-made billionaire woman in US, as per Forbes. The 34-year-old has a net worth of $1.4 billion. She was ranked 21st overall in 'America's Richest Self-Made Women' list and is the only billionaire under 40 on the list. After Rihanna, the next-youngest billionaire on Forbes' list is 41-year-old Kim Kardashian, with $1.8 billion net worth.

214.title: What multiple records were broken during England-India Edgbaston Test?
214.article_body: England recorded their highest-ever successful Test chase (378 runs) against India in Edgbaston Test. Rishabh Pant scored most runs in an overseas Test by an India wicketkeeper (203). Stuart Broad set the record for conceding most runs in an over in a Test (35), while Jasprit Bumrah scored the most runs in an over in a Test (29).

215.title: Joe Root's 'pinky finger' celebration after smashing his 28th Test hundred goes viral
215.article_body: A video of former England captain Joe Root's 'pinky finger' celebration after smashing his 28th hundred in Test cricket has gone viral. After reaching the three-figure mark against India in England's second innings in the Edgbaston Test, Root was seen pointing his pinky finger towards the England dressing room. Root has now hit nine Test tons against India.

216.title: Delhi Police starts registering Kanwariyas ahead of Kanwar Yatra
216.article_body: Delhi Police has started the registration of the Kanwariyas who are going to take part in the Kanwar Yatra. The registration process, which began on July 5, will help in making the yatra safe and easy for the Kanwariyas and enable authorities to provide quick aid, the police said. The Kanwar Yatra is scheduled to begin on July 14.

217.title: 8 injured in mass shooting at a park in US' Minneapolis
217.article_body: Eight people were injured in a mass shooting at Boom Island Park in US' Minneapolis during unofficial American Independence Day celebrations on Monday, according to officials. "We were just watching fireworks and we just heard a whole bunch of shots," a witness said. No immediate arrest was made after the shooting incident, according to the police.

218.title: Negotiations with IMF for bailout are complicated, says Sri Lanka PM
218.article_body: Sri Lanka's talks with the International Monetary Fund for a bailout package are complicated as it is a bankrupt nation, said Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe. Sri Lanka is currently experiencing its worst economic crisis, with massive shortage of essential goods and its foreign exchange levels falling drastically. Citizens have hit the streets to protest against the government.

219.title: Indonesian school helps deaf students recite Quran in sign language
219.article_body: A school in Indonesia's Yogyakarta is teaching students with hearing impairments how to recite the Quran in sign language. The Darul A'shom school, which opened in 2019, has 12 staff members and 115 students aged 7-28 years. Only three out of 10 children with disabilities in Indonesia are able to go to school, a UNICEF survey has shown.

220.title: I don't have the guts to get a cosmetic surgery done: Alaya F
220.article_body: During an Ask Me Anything session on Instagram, actress Alaya F was asked whether she has done any cosmetic surgery. To which, she responded, "No, I haven't. Nothing at all. I've thought about it but I've realised...I don't have the guts. I think I'll thank myself later on if I don't." "I don't think I ever will," she added.

221.title: I hope Shamshera gives me the wings to fly high: Director Karan Malhotra
221.article_body: Speaking about his film 'Shamshera', director Karan Malhotra said, "Hopefully, Shamshera gives me the wings to fly and fly high." "I hope, I get the opportunity to do these films. Nobody can predict the future and for every filmmaker, it's about falling in love with that one idea, which can be anything. Right now, I'm enjoying this space," he added.

222.title: Huge scam in Dalit Bandhu beneficiaries' selection: T'gana Cong MP
222.article_body: Telangana Congress MP N Uttam Kumar Reddy on Tuesday alleged a huge scam in the Dalit Bandhu scheme and demanded a probe. "More than poor Dalits, the scheme is proving to be an income scheme for TRS leaders," Reddy said. He said many Dalit families were being forced to pay commission for their selection as a beneficiary of the scheme.

223.title: Tamil Nadu waiting for an 'Eknath Shinde' to emerge: BJP's Annamalai
223.article_body: After rebel Shiv Sena leader Eknath Shinde-led new government was formed in Maharashtra, BJP's Tamil Nadu President K Annamalai said that Tamil Nadu is also waiting for an 'Eknath Shinde' to emerge. "Just like how...Eknath Shinde sprung up in...Shiv Sena, Tamil Nadu Cabinet headed by DMK leader MK Stalin is also...waiting for an Eknath Shinde to emerge," he said.

224.title: 3 given life term for abduction and murder of 14-yr-old in Punjab
224.article_body: The district court in Punjab's Kapurthala on Monday awarded life imprisonment to three individuals for the kidnapping and murder of a 14-year-old boy in 2016. One of the convicts is a cousin of the deceased victim, the prosecution informed. The convicts had conspired to demand a ransom of ₹30 lakhs from the boy's father, a local industrialist, the prosecution added.

225.title: Navy's INS Satpura participates in 'Rim of the Pacific' exercise
225.article_body: Indian Navy's frigate INS Satpura and a P8I aircraft are participating in this year's 'Rim of the Pacific' naval exercise, known as the largest international maritime warfare exercise. After conclusion of the ongoing harbour phase of the exercise, the sea phase will commence on July 12. Navies of 26 countries are participating in this year's exercise.

226.title: 6-year-old falls into water-filled lift duct in Maharashtra, dies
226.article_body: A six-year-old boy died after falling into a water-filled lift duct in Maharashtra, a police official said. The boy, Vedant Jadhav, had gone missing at 11:30 am and an investigation found him in the lift duct which was in an under-construction building in Thane's Dombivali area. Jadhav had gone to retrieve his ball that he was playing with.

227.title: Turkey's annual inflation at 78.62%; highest in 24 years
227.article_body: Turkey's annual inflation was 78.62% at the end of June - the highest rate in over two decades, according to data released by Turkish Statistical Institute. Consumer prices increased by 4.95% on a monthly comparison. The worst hit sectors were transportation, food and beverage where annual prices surged by 123.37% and 93.93% respectively. Critics blame government policies for the situation.

228.title: Madhavan shares AR Rahman's reaction to Rocketry, says 'Unforgettable moments'
228.article_body: Actor-filmmaker Madhavan shared a video from the premiere of his directorial debut 'Rocketry: The Nambi Effect' at the Cannes Film Festival. In the video, AR Rahman praised Madhavan as a director. "What a direction. Every dialogue was great," Rahman could be heard telling Madhavan. Reacting to his appreciation, Madhavan tweeted, "Unforgettable moments of my life...@arrahman sir...Thank you."

229.title: I hope Tesla doesn't need to enter mining industry: Elon Musk
229.article_body: Elon Musk said he hopes that Tesla does not need to enter the mining industry owing to its limitations. Speaking on the Getting Stoned podcast, Musk took the example of lithium and said that to make lithium-ion batteries, the refining process to achieve lithium's purity can be a chokepoint. Tesla would rather focus its talent on sustainability transition, Musk added.

230.title: Mamata's security increased; police at secretariat can't use phone
230.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee's security has been increased days after a man sneaked into her residence despite presence of a large number of police personnel. The state government has also decided that police personnel posted at the state secretariat can't use mobile phones during duty hours. The police personnel will have to deposit their mobile phones before joining duty.

231.title: Tata Motors' disqualification from BEST's bid upheld by Bombay HC
231.article_body: The Bombay HC upheld the Brihanmumbai Electric Supply and Transport Undertaking's (BEST Undertaking) decision to disqualify Tata Motors from a tender bid for supplying 1,400 e-buses. It said BEST was right to disqualify Tata Motors for being "technically unresponsive". However, it also held the winning bidder, Evey Trans, as "non-responsive" and directed BEST to call for fresh bids, if required.

232.title: Djokovic registers 215-minute 5-set comeback win, reaches his 11th Wimbledon semis
232.article_body: Six-time Wimbledon champion Novak Djokovic registered a comeback victory after losing first two sets against Italian tennis player Jannik Sinner in the Wimbledon 2022 men's singles quarter-finals. Djokovic won the match with a scoreline of 5-7, 2-6, 6-3, 6-2, 6-2 in 215 minutes. With this, Djokovic entered the Wimbledon semi-finals for the 11th time in his career.

233.title: 'Startup founder' most searched keyword on Shaadi.com, not IAS or IPS: MoS IT
233.article_body: Minister of State (MoS) for IT Rajeev Chandrasekhar at a recent event said he has been informed by reliable sources that the most searched keyword on Shaadi.com now is 'startup employee' or 'startup founder'. "It's not IAS, not IPS...not Tata company or Birla company," he added. "What better judge of what is a successful career than Shaadi.com," Chandrasekhar further said.

234.title: Nepotism will always be there in the film industry: Rajkummar Rao
234.article_body: Actor Rajkummar Rao has stated that nepotism will always be there in the film industry, adding that your work and talent will speak. He further said that he has friends who were his classmates but are getting recognition now because of OTT platforms. "Jaideep (Ahlawat) who did so well in 'Paatal Lok' and Pratik (Gandhi) in 'Scam 1992'," Rajkummar added.

235.title: 3 people burn to death after collision between trucks in Jodhpur
235.article_body: Three people were burnt to death after a head-on collision between two trucks in Jodhpur's Shergarh area during late hours of Monday, police said on Tuesday. The collision triggered a fire in the fuel tank of one of the trucks, they added. The drivers of the trucks and an assistant were killed after getting trapped in the fire, police informed.

236.title: I express my deep regret: Kerala minister on anti-Constitution remarks
236.article_body: Kerala minister Saji Cherian on Tuesday expressed "deep regret" for his controversial statements criticising the Constitution, saying his remarks were "misinterpreted". "I respect our Constitution...The news that I criticised the Constitution is twisted," he added. Earlier today, Cherian had said that the Indian Constitution was written in a way that can be used to "exploit" people.

237.title: I'm not afraid of failing: Bairstow after twin tons vs India in 5th Test
237.article_body: After scoring 106 and 114* in England's seven-wicket win against India in rescheduled fifth Test, England batter Jonny Bairstow said he's not afraid of failing. "I just have an enjoyment factor now...just want to put pressure on the opposition," he added. Chasing 378, Bairstow and Joe Root added 269-run partnership for fourth wicket. Bairstow was adjudged 'Player of the Match'.

238.title: Trying to rewrite how Test cricket is played in Eng: Stokes on 5th Test win
238.article_body: After England levelled the five-match series 2-2 with a seven-wicket win over India, England captain Ben Stokes said, "When the lads play like this, it makes my job easier." He added, "When you have clarity like we have in the dressing room, it makes chasing totals like this [378] easier...we're trying to rewrite how Test cricket is played in England."

239.title: No praise high enough for these two: Jaffer on Bairstow and Root
239.article_body: Praising Joe Root(142*) and Jonny Bairstow(106, 114*) following their centuries in the rescheduled fifth Test against India, Wasim Jaffer tweeted, "No praise high enough for these two! Root is the best test batter right now, but the way Bairstow rose to the challenge in both innings was superb. You just got to doff your hat and say well played."

240.title: OPS seeks Jaishankar's aid for rescue of 12 Indian fishermen
240.article_body: All India Anna Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam (AIADMK) leader O Panneerselvam has requested the aid of External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar for release of 12 Indian fishermen captured by the Sri Lankan Navy. The Sri Lankan Navy arrested the fisherfolk for allegedly fishing in the country's territorial waters. Of the arrested fishermen, seven are from Tamil Nadu and five from Puducherry.

241.title: Bomb blast kills 2 UN peacekeepers, injures 5 others in Mali
241.article_body: Two United Nations peacekeepers were killed and five others severely wounded after a convoy was hit by an improvised explosive device in Mali on Tuesday, the UN peacekeeping mission, MINUSMA, said. A rapid intervention force was sent to the scene and the injured were evacuated, it added. The attack may constitute a war crime under international law, it further said.

242.title: Haryana to provide free health facilities to HIV positive patients
242.article_body: Haryana Chief Minister Manohar Lal Khattar has approved a proposal to provide free health facilities such as radiological and laboratory tests to HIV positive patients. The free health facilities are being provided under the Public Private Partnership mode, which currently includes seven categories. Currently, around 22,000 HIV patients in the state are taking Antiretroviral Therapy (ART).

243.title: European Parliament passes two laws to regulate Big Tech dominance
243.article_body: The European Parliament has passed the Digital Markets Act (DMA) and the Digital Services Act (DSA) which will help control the dominance of companies such as Apple, Amazon, Facebook, Google and Microsoft. While the DMA targets monopolisation in the digital markets, the DSA bans targeted advertising aimed at children or based on sensitive data. Companies will face fines for violations.

244.title: BJP could sense growing discontent among Sena MLAs: Fadnavis
244.article_body: Deputy CM of Maharashtra Devendra Fadnavis asserted that BJP could sense the growing discontent among the Shiv Sena legislators for the last three to four months. "They were reeling under a lack of leadership. So, we waited for the opportunity and then made our masterstroke," he said. Maharashtra will see new heights of prosperity under CM Eknath Shinde, he added.

245.title: Govt releases list of states/UTs best in implementing National Food Security Act
245.article_body: Centre released the first State Ranking Index for implementation of National Food Security Act, with Odisha, UP and Andhra Pradesh topping the General Category states/UTs. Among the Special Category states/UTs, Tripura stood first, followed by Himachal Pradesh and Sikkim. They were judged on three points- coverage, targeting and provisions of the Act; delivery platform; and nutrition initiatives.

246.title: I never backed any film or mentioned smoking: Mahua on remarks over Goddess Kali
246.article_body: TMC MP Mahua Moitra clarified her remark about Goddess Kali, wherein she said, "To me, Kali is a meat-eating and alcohol-accepting Goddess." "I never backed any...film...or poster or mentioned...smoking. Suggest you visit...Maa Kali in Tarapith to see what food & drink is offered as bhog," she tweeted. This comes amid controversy over poster of 'Kaali', which shows the Goddess smoking.

247.title: Vaani is so focused, I'd try to distract her on 'Shamshera' set: Ranbir
247.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor called his 'Shamshera' co-star Vaani Kapoor a very fine actor, adding that she is so focused that she is always wearing headphones on set and trying to be in character. "Many times I've tried to distract her and just have [a] stupid conversation," the actor added. He further said that the two have really befriended each other.

248.title: Man who intruded into CM Mamata's house carried iron rod: Police
248.article_body: The man who intruded into West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee's residence had carried an iron rod with him, the police said on Tuesday. The rod was hidden under the man's shirt, but it fell on the ground during his escape attempt, an officer said. "We are questioning him to know the purpose of carrying it with him," the officer added.

249.title: Wanted to be contestant on 'Jhalak...' but was told I'm not famous: Maniesh
249.article_body: Host-actor Maniesh Paul has revealed that he had initially wanted to appear as a contestant on dance reality show 'Jhalak Dikhhla Jaa' but was told he doesn't have a famous enough face. Maniesh was later asked to host the show. "I signed [the contract]...I didn't even read it and that again became a turning point," he added.

250.title: US has so far witnessed 309 mass shootings in 2022: Report
250.article_body: US has so far witnessed 309 mass shootings and 15 mass killings in 2022, according to data by Gun Violence Archive (GVA). This comes as at least six people were shot dead and several others left injured during Independence Day Parade in Illinois. As per GVA data, 10,072 people have died due to firearms so far in US this year.

251.title: Katariya's 45th-min goal helps India hold China to a 1-1 draw in women's hockey WC 2022
251.article_body: India held China to a 1-1 draw on Tuesday to register their second straight draw in the women's hockey World Cup 2022. Jiali Zheng opened the scoring for China in the 26th minute with a field goal, before India's Vandana Katariya equalised in the 45th minute with a penalty corner. India are currently second on the Pool B points table.

252.title: Someone once told me that I'm too pretty for a role: Prachi Desai
252.article_body: Actress Prachi Desai said someone told her that she's "too pretty" for certain kind of roles. She added, "I said 'thank you' to the director for at least telling me that. I am just happy here that they are not doubting my skill, they don't think I lack anything there." "I...don't know what's the right reaction for that," she said.

253.title: Vijay Kumar Janjua appointed Chief Secretary of Punjab
253.article_body: The Punjab government has appointed Vijay Kumar Janjua as Chief Secretary to the Government of Punjab and in addition, Principal Secretary of the Department of Personnel and Vigilance. Earlier, the position was held by Anirudh Tewari. Tewari has now been posted as the Director General of Mahatma Gandhi State Institute of Public Administration.

254.title: Talks to convert Delhi into full UT, move will face resistance: Kejriwal
254.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Tuesday alleged that the Centre might dissolve the Delhi Assembly and convert the city into a full Union Territory, adding that the move will face stiff resistance from residents. "They (BJP) fear the AAP and that is why they do not want elections. Kejriwal will keep coming and going, Kejriwal is not important," he said.

255.title: Turkey should play by the rules: Greek Defence Minister
255.article_body: Greek Defence Minister Nikolaos Panagiotopoulos on Tuesday said that Greece "would like to be able to engage with Turkey but Turkey has to play by the rules". "Turkey should not be playing by its own rules, especially rules like the rule of military might and unilateral actions," he added. The two countries have differences over several issues.

256.title: Razorpay shared donor data with police without informing us: Alt News; Razorpay replies
256.article_body: Razorpay has responded after fact-checking website Alt News said that the payments gateway handed over its donor data to the police without informing them. Razorpay said that it received an official written notice from police authorities which it complied with, by sharing the data. "We tried reaching out to the company but did not receive any response," it further said.

257.title: 'Khuda...' makers apologise for hurting religious sentiments with song Haq Hussain
257.article_body: The makers of 'Khuda Haafiz: Chapter II – Agni Pariksha' have issued an apology for hurting religious sentiments of Shia Muslims with song 'Haq Hussain'. The makers have removed the zanjeer blades from the song and changed the lyrics to 'Junoon Hai'. They further clarified that no member of the Shia Muslim community has been presented in a bad light.

258.title: Cong has no right to demand HM's resignation over PSI scam: K'taka CM
258.article_body: Criticising Congress for demanding Karnataka Home Minister Araga Jnanendra's resignation over his alleged involvement in the Police Sub-Inspector recruitment scam, CM Basavaraj Bommai on Tuesday said the opposition party has no "moral right". It is only because of Jnanendra's honesty and efficiency that irregularities were exposed during the preliminary investigation, the CM added.

259.title: Action to be taken if posters of film 'Kaali' not removed: MP minister
259.article_body: Madhya Pradesh Home Minister Narottam Mishra on Tuesday said strict action will be taken if posters of the documentary 'Kaali', showing the goddess smoking a cigarette, are not removed. He said goddess Kaali's "insult" will not be tolerated. "We will also think about getting this film banned in Madhya Pradesh," he added.

260.title: Fan makes Dinesh Karthik's portrait with 600 Rubik's Cubes, video goes viral
260.article_body: A video of a fan making cricketer Dinesh Karthik's portrait with 600 Rubik's Cubes has gone viral on social media. Karthik also responded to the fan's video, writing, "Very nice work Prithvi...Highly impressive." Meanwhile, a Twitter user commented, "Unreal. Simply superb. Great form of Art. Keep it going." Karthik recently made his comeback to Team India.

261.title: India may not depend on imported urea after 2023–24: Mandaviya
261.article_body: Union Minister for Chemicals and Fertilisers Mansukh Mandaviya on Tuesday said, "By 2025, through eight urea plants, India will produce 44 crore Nano Urea Bottles per annum which will be equivalent to 200 LMT...conventional urea." With this, import of urea may not be required in India after 2023-24 and the government will save ₹40,000 crore approximately per annum, he added.

262.title: Emirates plane flies for 14 hours from Dubai to Australia with large hole on its side
262.article_body: An Emirates flight from Dubai to Brisbane flew for around 14 hours with a large hole on its side. The airline said it was created when one of the tyres burst shortly after take-off. "At no point did it have...impact on...fuselage, frame or structure of...aircraft," Emirates stated. No passengers were injured and the flight was able to complete its journey.

263.title: My middle-class roots keep me grounded: Kartik on 'Bhool...' success
263.article_body: Speaking about being level-headed amid success, actor Kartik Aaryan said that his middle-class roots keep him grounded. The actor added he will always be "this guy from Gwalior" who had dreams and ambitions to chase. Kartik further said even if things around him change, he will fundamentally not change at all. His 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' has grossed ₹230 crore worldwide.

264.title: 16-yr-old Indian-origin boy stabbed to death in UK, 3 people charged
264.article_body: A man and two teenagers have been charged with the murder of a 16-year-old Indian-origin boy who was allegedly stabbed to death in UK's Wolverhampton on June 29. The victim, identified as Ronan Kanda, died at the scene after being stabbed twice, post-mortem report revealed. "Detectives are keen to hear from anyone...who may have captured dashcam footage of...attack," police said.

265.title: 34-year-old mother-of-two Maria reaches first Grand Slam semis at Wimbledon
265.article_body: World number 103 Tatjana Maria came from 2-4 down in the final set to beat fellow German Jule Niemeier 4-6, 6-2, 7-5 to reach her maiden Grand Slam semi-final at Wimbledon on Tuesday. The 34-year-old mother of two won the quarter-final match in two hours 18 minutes. "I've goosebumps everywhere. It was such a tough match against Jule," said Maria.

266.title: It was my proposal to make Eknath Shinde Maha CM: Devendra Fadnavis
266.article_body: BJP leader and Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis on Tuesday said, "It was my proposal to make Eknath Shinde the CM..but senior party leaders insisted that government won't run if I stayed out of it, so I accepted the Deputy CM post on their command." He added that it is his responsibility to ensure that Shinde is a successful CM.

267.title: Israelis are lucky to have Yair Lapid as PM: French Prez Macron
267.article_body: French President Emmanuel Macron on Tuesday said that the people of Israel are lucky to have Yair Lapid as the new Prime Minister. Macron made the comment ahead of a meeting with the Israeli leader in Paris. Notably, it is the first overseas trip by Lapid since he took over as the caretaker PM last week.

268.title: Balancing emotion, humour without crossing line difficult: 'JugJugg...' director
268.article_body: 'JugJugg Jeeyo' director Raj Mehta has said that trying to balance emotion and humour is creatively very difficult, adding they had to make sure the line is not crossed. "It's gratifying to see the reaction [to the film]," he said. Raj added that it's a family film and they had enough sensibility to understand the difference between right and wrong.

269.title: Experts to visit K'taka districts to look into back-to-back tremors
269.article_body: A team of experts from Hyderabad-based CSIR-National Geophysical Research Institute will soon visit Kodagu and Dakshina Kannada districts in Karnataka to look into back-to-back earthquakes in the two districts. "The district administrations in the two districts have already instructed officials to continuously monitor the situation," Karnataka Revenue Minister R Ashoka said.

270.title: IAS officer arrested for sexually harassing IIT student after a party in Jharkhand
270.article_body: Sub-Divisional Officer of Khunti Sayyed Riyaj Ahemed was arrested on Monday for allegedly sexually harassing an IIT student in Jharkhand, police said. The 2019-batch IAS officer allegedly harassed the girl after attending dinner party hosted at the Deputy Development Commissioner's residence. Prima facie, the allegation was found to be true after Ahemed and guests were questioned, police said.

271.title: Karan Johar donates ₹11 lakh for Assam flood relief, CM thanks him
271.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar donated ₹11 lakh for flood relief to the Assam Chief Minister's Relief Fund on Tuesday. Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma shared the news on Twitter, writing, "Grateful to...Karan Johar and Dharma Productions for contributing ₹11 lakh to CM Relief Fund." Biswa also thanked filmmaker Rohit Shetty for his initiative of getting the film industry together for Assam.

272.title: Don't know what went wrong: Dhaakad producer on film's failure at box office
272.article_body: Speaking about the failure of film Dhaakad, producer Deepak Mukut said, "I don't know what went wrong but I would like to believe that it's people's choice, what they accept and what they not and what they want to watch as well." "But according to us, we feel proud to have made a good, female-led spy action thriller," he added.

273.title: Ex-H'yana CM Chautala moves HC challenging sentencing by trial court
273.article_body: Ex-Haryana CM Om Prakash Chautala has moved to the Delhi High Court, challenging a trial court's order which sentenced him to four years imprisonment in a disproportionate assets case. Chautala's Advocate Harsh Sharma has confirmed the move. The trial court had also imposed a ₹50 lakh fine on Chautala and ordered the confiscation of his four properties in the order.

274.title: Pics show waterlogging in Mumbai after heavy rain
274.article_body: Heavy rainfall in Mumbai and its suburbs on Monday night and Tuesday morning left several parts of the city waterlogged, leading to disruption of traffic movement. Officials said local train services were affected mainly on Central Railway's main and harbour corridors due to waterlogging on tracks. The IMD has issued an orange alert in the city till July 8.

275.title: Could have become CM had I requested: Maharashtra Deputy CM Fadnavis
275.article_body: Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis on Tuesday said he could have become the Chief Minister of the state had he requested. "We made Shiv Sena (leader) CM for ideology," he said. Fadnavis added, "It was my proposal to make Eknath Shinde CM, but senior party leaders said the government won't run if I stayed out."

276.title: Uddhav Thackeray, Sanjay Raut not accepting reality: Kirit Somaiya
276.article_body: As Shiv Sena's Uddhav Thackeray and Sanjay Raut continued to criticise the newly-elected Eknath Shinde-led government, BJP leader Kirit Somaiya condemned them, saying they are not accepting the reality. "Thackeray needs to introspect now. Raut is accusing BJP of betraying them, rather he betrayed us by taking votes in the name of PM Modi in the 2019 elections," Somaiya said.

277.title: Keanu Reeves answers fan's 'rapid fire' questions at US airport
277.article_body: Actor Keanu Reeves, who recently travelled from London to New York, replied to the "rapid-fire" questions of a fan after landing in US. Television producer Andrew Kimmel shared the encounter on Twitter which is going viral. The fan asked Keanu for an autograph and asked questions like where he is staying and what he will do which Keanu "happily" answered.

278.title: Confident that Murmu will comfortably win Prez elections: Bihar CM
278.article_body: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar on Tuesday said he is confident that NDA's Presidential candidate Droupadi Murmu will comfortably win the election. "It's a matter of happiness that a tribal woman is running for the highest constitutional position of the country," Nitish Kumar said. Droupadi Murmu, who visited Patna, met NDA leaders and sought their support for the upcoming Presidential elections.

279.title: HC judge threatened for exposing BJP's corrupt govt in K'taka: Rahul
279.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Tuesday criticised the BJP government for threatening an HC judge with transfer for exposing the party's corrupt government in Karnataka. "Institution after institution is being bulldozed by the BJP. Each of us must stand with those fearlessly doing their duty," Gandhi said, using the hashtag #DaroMat.

280.title: Regularisation of pourakarmikas' services has begun: K'taka CM
280.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Tuesday announced that regularisation of pourakarmikas' services has begun in the state. The pourakarmikas, who were protesting since July 1 demanding regularisation of their services, called off their protest and welcomed the government's decision. "Realising their plight, I had announced ₹2000 monthly hardship allowance for them in the budget," Bommai said.

281.title: Will present debt restructuring programme to IMF by Aug: Sri Lanka PM
281.article_body: Amid ongoing economic crisis, Sri Lankan PM Ranil Wickremesinghe told the parliament on Tuesday that the country will present a debt restructuring programme to the International Monetary Fund (IMF) by August to seek a bailout package. He added that negotiating with IMF is more challenging than earlier due to the nation's bankruptcy. Sri Lanka's total foreign debt is $51 billion.

282.title: I cried when Alia Bhatt told me she was having a baby: Karan Johar
282.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar revealed that he cried when actress Alia Bhatt told him that she was having a baby. "My first emotion was that tears just came out and she came and gave me a hug," he added. Karan further said it's like his baby is having a baby and he can't wait to hold her child in his arms.

283.title: Bombay HC refuses to grant relief to woman alleging forced marriage
283.article_body: The Bombay HC has refused to annul the marriage of a 33-year-old woman, who claimed that she was forced to marry the man and was tortured by him since she was 14 years old. A division bench of Justices KR Shriram and PK Chavan said that the evidence provided by the woman was "improbable, unbelievable and unacceptable".

284.title: Zimbabwe to introduce gold coins amid high inflation rate
284.article_body: The Reserve Bank of Zimbabwe said it will introduce gold coins as a store of value to control the inflation rate that has considerably weakened the local currency. The Governor of the bank said that the gold coins will be called 'Mosi-oa-tunya'. The term, inspired by Victoria falls, means the smoke that thunders.

285.title: HDFC-HDFC Bank merger gets 'no objection' letter from RBI
285.article_body: HDFC Bank on Monday said it has received the Reserve Bank of India's (RBI) approval for its potential merger with its parent company HDFC. "The RBI has accorded its 'no objection' for the scheme...subject to certain conditions," it stated. The merger, which received approval from BSE and NSE last week, remains subject to approvals from the CCI and the NCLT.

286.title: Tiger Shroff's mother shares pics showing his grandfather who fought in WWII at 18
286.article_body: Actor Tiger Shroff's mother, Ayesha Shroff, on Tuesday shared pictures of her father who fought in World War II. "Tiger's grandfather training to fly Tiger Moths. I guess he was around 18 or 19...when he fought in World War II," she wrote. "Decorated for his bravery by his India. I'm proud to be his daughter. Jai Hind," Ayesha added.

287.title: Was on verge of alcoholism when 'Dil Pe Mat Le Yaar!!' didn't work: Hansal
287.article_body: Filmmaker Hansal Mehta has revealed that he was on the verge of becoming "a certified alcoholic" when his 2000 film 'Dil Pe Mat Le Yaar!!' didn't work. "There was political backlash...I got depressed for 6-7 months...Luckily something snapped," he added. Hansal said he picked up the pieces and made 2002 film 'Chhal' and has never given up at the start.

288.title: We fell short with the bat on Day 4: Bumrah on India's loss at Edgbaston
288.article_body: After India lost the rescheduled fifth Test against England by seven wickets at Edgbaston, India stand-in captain Jasprit Bumrah said his side fell short with the bat on Day 4. "And that is where we let the opposition in to let the match slip away from us," he added. India were bowled out for 245 in their second innings.

289.title: Indian tech startups can reach $200 bn revenue in 5 yrs: Chiratae Chairman
289.article_body: Indian technology startups have the potential to reach a revenue scale of $200 billion in the next five years, according to Chiratae Ventures Chairman Sudhir Sethi. In same time frame, at least 25 new-age technology companies will have a revenue of at least $1 billion each, he said. He added that venture equity capital is expected to grow about 10%.

290.title: India slip below Pakistan in World Test Championship standings after points penalty
290.article_body: India have slipped below Pakistan in the World Test Championship (WTC) standings after being penalised for slow over-rate against England in Edgbaston Test. After being docked two points, India are now fourth on WTC points table with 52.08% of points won, while Pakistan are third with 52.38% of points won. India have also been fined 40% of their match fee.

291.title: 8-member SIT to probe security breach at Bengal CM's home in Kolkata
291.article_body: Kolkata Police has constituted an eight-member Special Investigation Team to probe the security breach at West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee's residence. A man was arrested for allegedly sneaking into the CM's residence in Kalighat on July 3. The man told the police that he did so thinking it was the Kolkata Police headquarters.

292.title: TMC condemns MP Mahua's 'Kaali is meat-eating, alcohol-accepting goddess for me' remark
292.article_body: Amid controversy over the poster of the documentary film 'Kaali', TMC MP Mahua Moitra on Tuesday said, "To me, Kaali is a meat-eating and alcohol-accepting goddess." TMC distanced itself from her remarks. "The comments made by [Moitra] and her views expressed on Goddess Kali have been made in her personal capacity...All India Trinamool Congress strongly condemns such comments," it tweeted.

293.title: We first thought 'Tu Cheez...' will look cheap: Shabbir Boxwala
293.article_body: Filmmaker Shabbir Boxwala said the team of 1994 film 'Mohra' thought that 'Tu Cheez Badi Hai Mast' will look cheap. He added lyricist Anand Bakshi said it's about alcohol and won't be degrading to the girl. Shabbir further said they had a tie-up with Bagpiper but they backed out, adding the Bagpiper person later called it his life's biggest mistake.

294.title: There was total belief while chasing down 378-run target at Edgbaston: Root
294.article_body: England batter Joe Root said there was absolute clarity and total belief while his side was chasing down the 378-run target in the rescheduled fifth Test at Edgbaston. "Absolutely didn't think of stepping away from the game," he added. Root, who was adjudged 'Player of the Series', scored 142* in the fourth innings. England beat India by seven wickets.

295.title: Ranveer to reprise Mukesh Khanna's role in 'Shaktimaan' remake: Reports
295.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh will reportedly enter into Mukesh Khanna's shoes and play the character of 'Shaktimaan' on the silver screen. According to reports, Mukesh Khanna's Bheeshm International had announced the remake of the classic superhero show 'Shaktimaan'. Reports added, Ranveer showed a keen interest in playing Shaktimaan and makers too feel he can bring a natural charisma to the character.

296.title: Bengal has turned into pile of explosives: LoP Suvendu writes to Amit Shah
296.article_body: West Bengal Leader of Opposition Suvendu Adhikari, in a letter to Union Home Minister Amit Shah, on Tuesday said, "The state has turned into a...pile of explosives." Adhikari also demanded an investigation by the National Investigation Agency (NIA) over the "alarming situation in the state". Adhikari claimed a man died when the crude bomb he was making exploded.

297.title: Govt to earn ₹94,800 crore from windfall tax on domestic crude oil: Moody's
297.article_body: The government will generate close to $12 billion (₹94,800 crore) of additional revenue from windfall taxes on domestic crude oil production and fuel exports, as per an estimate by Moody's Investors Service. The tax increase will reduce profits of Reliance Industries and ONGC, it added. Last week, the government imposed a ₹23,230 per tonne charge on domestically produced crude oil.

298.title: Platforms have right to court, but must follow our laws: MoS IT amid Twitter lawsuit
298.article_body: Minister of State (MoS) for IT Rajeev Chandrasekhar said all foreign internet platforms have the right to court and judicial review in India. "But equally all...platforms operating here...have unambiguous obligation to comply with our laws," he tweeted. While Chandrasekhar didn't name any intermediary, the remarks come after reports of Twitter suing the government over content takedown orders.

299.title: US State Secy to meet Chinese Foreign Minister in Bali this week
299.article_body: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken will hold talks with Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi in Bali this week, the State Department said. The talks will be held on the sidelines of G20 Foreign Ministers' meeting. Reportedly, the announcement comes as US President Joe Biden is considering scrapping tariffs on a range of Chinese goods to curb inflation in America.

300.title: Delhi records 32 cases of dengue in June, 143 so far this year
300.article_body: Delhi reported 32 cases of dengue in June, taking the tally of total dengue cases in the national capital to 143 so far this year, as per MCD data released on Monday. According to the data, no deaths have been reported due to the infection this year. In 2021, Delhi recorded 9,613 cases, the highest in last five years.

301.title: Delhi HC orders setting up of 42 commercial courts within 6 months
301.article_body: Delhi High Court on Tuesday ordered the setting up of 42 commercial courts in the next six months for the speedy redressal of cases. The court also directed the administration to file an affidavit disclosing availability of judicial officers who could man these commercial courts. The court granted the petitioner permission to re-approach if the order was not complied with.

302.title: Ms Marvel character is special, stands for representation: Director
302.article_body: 'Ms Marvel' director Sharmeen Obaid-Chinoy has said that the character is special because it stands for representation. Ms Marvel, portrayed by Pakistani-Canadian actress Iman Vellani, is Marvel's first South-Asian superhero. Sharmeen further said, "As a Pakistani filmmaker, it is a dream to be able to bring the character to life...'Ms Marvel' has something for everyone."

303.title: S Arabia allows 1 mn hajj pilgrims in biggest turnout since pandemic
303.article_body: Saudi Arabia will welcome one million hajj pilgrims this year, including 8,50,000 persons from abroad, in the biggest turnout in two years since COVID-19 pandemic broke out. The vaccinated pilgrims, aged below 65 years, will attend the hajj under strict sanitary conditions with the Masjid al-Haram being disinfected 10 times a day. In 2019, about 2.5 million people performed hajj.

304.title: Nine killed as passenger bus falls 40 metres in Nepal
304.article_body: At least nine people were killed after a passenger bus lost control and plunged 40 metres in central Nepal's Bagmati province on Tuesday, officials said. The bus, which was en route to Kathmandu, was carrying 40 passengers at the time. The cause of the accident is being ascertained and injured persons have been sent to a local hospital, police said.

305.title: Varun Dhawan & Janhvi wrap Bawaal schedule in Amsterdam: Reports
305.article_body: Producer Sajid Nadiadwala and filmmaker Nitesh Tiwari announced their new project 'Bawaal', starring Varun Dhawan & Janhvi Kapoor, in March 2022. The film went on the floor recently and now, the two actors have wrapped the Amsterdam schedule. Janhvi took to Instagram to share a photo with Varun. The team will now head to Poland for the next stint.

306.title: Assam hit by 3.7 magnitude earthquake
306.article_body: Assam was hit by a 3.7 magnitude earthquake on Tuesday at 11:03am, the National Center for Seismology confirmed. According to the data provided by the government agency, the epicentre of the earthquake was located at a depth of 35 km. The agency has also recorded more than 20 earthquakes occurring off the coast of Andaman & Nicobar Islands since Sunday.

307.title: 20 students fall sick after eating meal at school in Telangana
307.article_body: Around 20 students of the Kasturba Gandhi Balika Vidyalaya (KGBV) in Telangana's Adilabad allegedly fell sick after they consumed the food served under mid-day meal scheme on Monday. Parents claimed that after eating the food, students began to vomit and were taken to Bhainsa Area Hospital. "We've already voiced our complaints to higher officials," parents said.

308.title: Fuel, electricity should be brought under GST ambit: CII President
308.article_body: The Confederation of Indian Industry's (CII) President and Bajaj Finserv Chairman Sanjiv Bajaj on Tuesday told PTI that items like electricity and fuel should be brought under the GST ambit. "[It]  will further help simplify, cut costs...[and] make industry more competitive," he stated. He added that the number of tax slabs under the GST should be brought down to three.

309.title: He humiliated the Constitution: MoS MEA on Kerala Minister's remarks
309.article_body: Minister of State for External Affairs V Muraleedharan criticised Kerala Minister Saji Cheriyan over his comments regarding the Indian Constitution, calling it an anti-national statement. "Kerala Minister Saji Cheriyan humiliated the Indian constitution in his speech," Muraleedharan said. Cheriyan allegedly said that Indian Constitution is written in a manner that can be used to exploit people.

310.title: NATO countries sign off accession protocols for Sweden, Finland
310.article_body: The 30 member-countries of NATO have approved the accession protocols to include Sweden and Finland into its military grouping, in a move to further strategically isolate Russia. However, there remains uncertainty over Parliamentary approval from Turkey, which could still hinder the joining process. Turkey has demanded the Nordic nations to extradite "terrorists" linked to outlawed Kurdish groups.

311.title: Mumbai woman sends ₹7 lakh to wrong account, beneficiary says 'won lottery'
311.article_body: Cybercrime officials in Mumbai helped a woman get back ₹7 lakh, which she had mistakenly transferred to the wrong beneficiary bank account. A man, who received the money, initially claimed the amount was disbursed to him as part of a lottery win. "He failed to prove the claims. After much persuasion, he finally reversed the transaction," an official said.

312.title: Man kills 30-year-old wife over extramarital affair in Delhi; held
312.article_body: A man allegedly killed his 30-year-old wife over an extramarital affair in Delhi's Rohini, a police official said on Tuesday. Rohini DCP Pranav Tayal said they received the information about the murder on July 3, adding that after reaching the spot, they found the woman, wrapped in a bedsheet, lying on the floor. Meanwhile, police have arrested the accused husband.

313.title: 15 fishermen missing after boat sinks off eastern Indonesia
313.article_body: Search is underway for the 15 fishermen who went missing on Saturday after their boat sank in the Arafura Sea off the coast of eastern Indonesia, authorities said Tuesday. "Ten people have been rescued safely, but 15 others remain missing," a spokesman of the Indonesian rescue services stated. He added that a navy warship would join the search on Tuesday.

314.title: Video shows Tesla car on Autopilot trying to turn in front of an oncoming tram in US
314.article_body: A video has surfaced online showing a Tesla car on Autopilot making an attempt to turn directly in front of an oncoming tram in US. In the video, the car moved to make the turn as soon as the traffic light turned green, without waiting for the tram to pass by. However, the driver immediately intervened, saying, "That's not okay."

315.title: 'Kaali' director booked in Delhi for poster of goddess smoking cigarette
315.article_body: Delhi Police has registered a case against Leena Manimekalai, the director of documentary 'Kaali', over a poster showing the goddess smoking cigarette. "Prima facie, the content appeared promoting enmity between different groups on grounds of religion and race," police said. It added the post was released on social media at a strategic time which is likely to entice religious sentiments.

316.title: Crypto lender Nexo offers to buy Vauld after it pauses operations
316.article_body: London-based crypto lender Nexo has signed an indicative term sheet with fellow lender Vauld that could potentially result in it acquiring the Singapore-based firm. Upon successful completion of the transaction, Nexo plans to acquire up to 100% stake in Vauld. This comes a day after Vauld suspended all operations on its platform citing "volatile market conditions" among other reasons.

317.title: 1,349 unlicensed weapons seized ahead of polls for urban bodies in MP
317.article_body: Authorities have seized 1,349 unlicensed weapons ahead of polls for urban local bodies in Madhya Pradesh, an official said. More than 2.58 lakh licensed arms holders deposited their weapons at their nearest police stations and preventive action had been taken against over 1.73 lakh persons, the official added. The polls will be held on July 6 and July 13.

318.title: Taliban govt to approach India regarding visas for Afghan students
318.article_body: The Taliban administration in Afghanistan has said that it will request India to issue visas to Afghan students enrolled in Indian educational institutes. The announcement was made by Taliban Foreign Minister Amir Khan Muttaqi after a meeting with Afghan students in Kabul on Monday, an official said. India recently reopened its embassy in Kabul but hasn't formally recognised Taliban government.

319.title: Hurt by turn of events, but will make Sena stronger: Uddhav
319.article_body: Shiv Sena president Uddhav Thackeray has said that he was "hurt" to see some members ditching the party despite getting benefits and will visit Hingoli soon. Thackeray told Sena workers that it was painful to see MLAs and ministers, who won because of Sena workers and got everything (positions in the party) have left him.

320.title: Aurangzeb & Akbar responsible for inflation, unemployment: Owaisi
320.article_body: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi on Tuesday criticised the BJP government and said that Aurangzeb and Akbar are responsible for inflation, fuel price hike and unemployment and not PM Narendra Modi. "If children don't have jobs, then emperor Akbar is responsible," he said. "Had Taj Mahal not been built, petrol would have cost just ₹40 per litre," he added.

321.title: FIR against Ajmer Dargah cleric who offered to gift his house to whoever beheads Nupur
321.article_body: Rajasthan Police has filed an FIR against Ajmer Sharif Dargah cleric Salman Chishti after a video showed him offering to gift his house to anyone who beheads suspended BJP leader Nupur Sharma for her remark on Prophet Muhammad. Dargah Station House Officer Dalveer Singh Faujdar said efforts are on to trace the 'khadim'. He said Salman has a criminal background.

322.title: Special win by England in 5th Test to level the series vs India: Tendulkar
322.article_body: Sachin Tendulkar took to Twitter to congratulate England on their seven-wicket win in rescheduled fifth Test against India. "Special win by England to level...series. Joe Root and Jonny Bairstow have been in sublime form and made batting look very easy," he wrote. Root(142*) and Bairstow(114*) both hit centuries in fourth innings to help England draw the five-match series 2-2.

323.title: Indian Constitution written in a way that can exploit people: Kerala minister
323.article_body: Kerala minister Saji Cherian, while addressing a recent political programme, allegedly said, "The Constitution of the country has been written in such a manner that can be used to exploit the maximum number of people." Retired Kerala High Court judge BK Pasha has reportedly sought Cherian's resignation from CM Pinarayi Vijayan. CM Vijayan has asked Cherian to give an explanation.

324.title: Windshield cracks on Guj-Mumbai flight in 2nd SpiceJet incident today, plane lands safely
324.article_body: A SpiceJet aircraft, flying from Kandla in Gujarat to Mumbai in Maharashtra, suffered a crack on its outer windshield and made an emergency landing in Mumbai. This is the second incident in the day where a SpiceJet plane had to make an emergency landing. All passengers and crew members are safe, the airline said in a statement.

325.title: Ours is a govt where nobody will be insulted: Maharashtra CM Shinde
325.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde on Tuesday said, "Ours is a government of common people. Ours is a government where nobody will be insulted." "Every community will be respected and taken forward...The state will be taken forward and the process of development will be taken forward," he added. Notably, Shinde-led state government won the floor test in Maharashtra Assembly on Monday.

326.title: Working with Kangana Ranaut in 'Simran' was a massive mistake: Hansal Mehta
326.article_body: Filmmaker Hansal Mehta talked about his experience of working with Kangana Ranaut in the film 'Simran' and admitted that working with her was a "massive mistake". Speaking to Mashable India, Hansal agreed that she is a good actress but also said they didn't gel with each other. He further said they had only shot what she wanted to shoot.

327.title: How does the WTC points table read after England's historic run chase against India?
327.article_body: After defeating India by recording their highest successful chase (378 runs) in Test cricket in the rescheduled fifth Test, England are seventh on the World Test Championship (WTC) points table with 33.33% of points won. Meanwhile, India are third with 53.47% of points won. The table is led by Australia, who have accumulated 77.78% of points won.

328.title: To me, Kaali is a meat-eating & alcohol-accepting goddess: Mahua
328.article_body: Amid controversy over the poster of the documentary 'Kaali' that shows the goddess smoking, TMC's Mahua Moitra on Tuesday said, "You have the freedom to imagine your goddess." "To me, Kaali is a meat-eating and alcohol-accepting goddess," she added. Moitra said there are some places where alcohol is offered to gods and in some other places it would be blasphemy.

329.title: CCTV footage of the moment Amravati chemist was murdered surfaces
329.article_body: A CCTV footage has surfaced weeks after the murder of Amravati chemist Umesh Kolhe, showing Kolhe surrounded by his killers before being attacked. Kolhe was stabbed to death by two men on a motorcycle on his way back from his medical shop. Kolhe was killed on June 21 after he shared a WhatsApp post supporting Nupur Sharma.

330.title: WhatsApp posts supporting Nupur forwarded on group by Amravati chemist surface
330.article_body: Some of the WhatsApp texts forwarded by Amravati chemist Umesh Kolhe, who was killed over WhatsApp forwards supporting suspended BJP leader Nupur Sharma, have been accessed by media. Kolhe reportedly forwarded messages supporting PM Narendra Modi and Nupur on a group called "Black Freedom". His post supporting Nupur was reportedly shared by his friend Yusuf Khan to other WhatsApp groups.

331.title: It was the biggest challenge for me to play Mithali: Taapsee
331.article_body: Actress Taapsee Pannu has said that playing former Indian women's cricket team captain Mithali Raj was the biggest challenge thrown at her in 'Shabaash Mithu'. "I'm anything but her in terms of demeanour. I took notice of her from her journey beyond cricket," she added. Taapsee further said that their ideologies are similar which helped them get along really well.

332.title: Rishi Kapoor was flamboyant & loud, Ranbir is complete opposite: Karan Malhotra
332.article_body: Director Karan Malhotra, who directed Ranbir Kapoor in 'Shamshera' and his late father, actor Rishi Kapoor in 'Agneepath', said that he has been fortunate to work with both of them. Elaborating on their differences, Karan said, "Chintu uncle was...very flamboyant, loud...and confrontational person." "Ranbir is the complete opposite...[He] is happy-go-lucky. He does his masti quietly," Karan added.

333.title: Absolutely listless: Sehwag on India's bowling in 4th innings of 5th Test
333.article_body: Virender Sehwag has said India's bowling in fourth innings of the rescheduled fifth Test in Edgbaston was "absolutely listless" following the visitors' seven-wicket loss. India managed to take three wickets in fourth innings. While Alex Lees was run out, Zak Crawley and Ollie Pope were dismissed by Jasprit Bumrah. "India have quite a few issues to address," Sehwag added.

334.title: India has signed MoUs to make UPI available in 3 countries: Vaishnaw
334.article_body: India has signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with Singapore, UAE and France to make Unified Payments System (UPI) available in these countries, Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw said. Addressing the inauguration of Digital India Week 2022, he added that India is currently in talks with 30 nations. Further, he stated that UPI has helped in avoiding the creation of monopolies.

335.title: Shiv Sena still hopeful of rebel MLAs' return to party: Sanjay Raut
335.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut on Tuesday said that the party is "still hopeful" of the rebel MLAs' return to former CM Uddhav Thackeray's side. "They are our people, will come back. 'Subha ka bhoola agar shaam ko ghar aa jaye to usse bhoola nahi kehte'," he said. "Shiv Sena is Balasaheb Thackeray's. Cannot be anyone else's," he added.

336.title: Will work round the clock to make Maha number 1 state: Fadnavis
336.article_body: Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis held a road-show in Nagpur on Tuesday. During the road-show he said, "We'll work round the clock to make Maharashtra the number one state in [India]." "We'll [Eknath Shinde-led state government] not only complete these 2.5 years in power, but will also form a government with a majority for the next five years," he added.

337.title: Cong workers put paper boats on Indore streets to protest against floods
337.article_body: Congress workers on Tuesday put paper boats on the waterlogged streets of Indore to protest against flooding concerns after heavy showers. A video of these party workers holding placards with scripted messages for Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan also surfaced online. Notably, urban local body polls will be held in Indore and Bhopal on July 6.

338.title: Nation wouldn't be in turmoil had PM, Shah appealed for peace: Baghel
338.article_body: Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel criticised the Centre over Nupur Sharma's comments, asserting that turmoil across the country could be avoided if PM Narendra Modi and Union Home Minister Amit Shah appealed for peace. He also took a jibe at BJP-ruled states and said that there haven't been proceedings in a single state where BJP was in power.

339.title: President Kovind calls Assam CM, enquires about flood situation
339.article_body: President Ram Nath Kovind on Tuesday called Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma and enquired about the prevailing flood situation in the state and the ongoing relief and rescue operations. "Extremely grateful for his concern. It'll boost our morale in overcoming this situation," Sarma tweeted. He said he was honoured to receive a call from the President.

340.title: Man critically injured after stray bull hits him in UP's Meerut
340.article_body: A man got critically injured after a bull hit him while he was going home in Uttar Pradesh's Meerut. Reportedly, the bull's attack was so severe that the man's intestines came out. Notably, this is the second such incident in a week as an elderly man in Meerut was killed and a youth was injured by stray cattle last Tuesday.

341.title: AAP will move court to conduct MCD elections on time: Delhi CM
341.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Tuesday alleged that the Centre was using force and hooliganism and not allowing MCD elections in the city. "We will have to approach the court to get MCD elections conducted on time and we will do it," he said in the Delhi Assembly. Kejriwal added, "They don't want elections to be conducted."

342.title: PM Modi has captured sentiments, aspirations of India: Jaishankar
342.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar on Tuesday praised PM Narendra Modi and said that he has captured the sentiments and aspirations of the entire country. Speaking at an event on the book 'Modi@20: Dreams Meet Delivery', Jaishankar said that before 2014, the "Delhi media" gave the status of "national leader" to all its "friends and favourites".

343.title: 4 killed, 3 injured in a car-jeep collision in Rajasthan's Dausa
343.article_body: Police said that four people were killed and three others were injured in a head-on collision between a car and a jeep in Rajasthan's Dausa district on Tuesday. The car was on its way to Khatu Shyam Temple in Sikar district. The deceased, Sanu Soni, Akash Soni, Neeraj Soni and Karmendra Soni, were residents of Uttar Pradesh's Kanpur, police added.

344.title: Srinagar-Leh highway blocked after flash floods in J&K's Ganderbal
344.article_body: A cloudburst triggered by heavy rainfall caused flash floods, which blocked the Srinagar-Leh highway in Jammu and Kashmir's Ganderbal district on Tuesday. As per reports, several houses were inundated and sustained partial damages after flash floods in the Kangan town of the district. Work is reportedly underway to clear the blocked highway.

345.title: B'luru locals oppose Swiss Consulate-proposed project at Cubbon Park
345.article_body: Locals have opposed the proposal of introduction of 'Barn Parcours' at Cubbon Park by the Swiss Consulate in Bengaluru. Cubbon Park Walkers Association's President Umesh Kumar said the proposal would set a wrong precedent as every private company will think they can pass their projects. "The park has already shrunk...There're several parks...we don't see anything happening over there," he added.

346.title: Tunisia buys 8 military training aircraft from US
346.article_body: Tunisia on Monday announced that it has bought eight military training aircraft from the US. The delivery of the planes will be completed by 2026, with the first batch expected to be delivered in March 2023, Tunisia's Defence Ministry said. The bulk of the deal financing will be through the American grant and Tunisia will pay the rest, it added.

347.title: Special from England, chasing historic target with a cigar in the mouth: Michael Vaughan
347.article_body: Reacting to England recording their highest successful chase in Test cricket against India in the rescheduled fifth Test, Michael Vaughan tweeted, "This is special from England...chasing a historic target with a cigar in the mouth."
