Joe Root scored 142*(173) and Jonny Bairstow scored 114*(145) to help England chase down a 378-run target in 76.4 overs.

348.title: Suicide bomb attack on Pak military convoy injures 10 soldiers
348.article_body: A suicide bomb attack on a Pakistani military convoy in North Waziristan district on Monday injured at least 10 soldiers, according to a senior official. Of these, three security personnel suffered serious injuries and were taken to a military hospital, according to sources. Notably, no group has so far claimed responsibility for the attack.

349.title: Kartik Aaryan takes his team on 1-week vacation for 'Bhool...' success
349.article_body: Actor Kartik Aaryan has taken his team on a one-week long vacation to Europe to celebrate the success of 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2'. As per reports, the team includes his managers, stylists, spot boy and security personnel. The film is 2022's biggest Bollywood opener at the Indian box office and grossed over ₹230 crore at the global box office.

350.title: Chris Hemsworth's look from Mad Max prequel 'Furiosa' surfaces online
350.article_body: Pictures of Chris Hemsworth from the sets of 'Furiosa', George Miller's prequel to 'Mad Max: Fury Road', have surfaced online, revealing his look from the upcoming project. Reacting to the pictures, a user tweeted, "Chris Hemsworth makes any movie worth it," while another comment read, "He's miles away from MCU Thor world here." 'Furiosa' will release on May 24, 2024.

351.title: Another accused in Udaipur murder case sent to NIA custody till July 12
351.article_body: An NIA court in Jaipur on Tuesday sent another Udaipur murder accused, Mohammad Mohsin, to the agency's custody till July 12. He was reportedly arrested on Monday for his alleged involvement in the conspiracy to kill Kanhaiya Lal. Last week, the prime accused, Mohammad Riyaz and Gaus Mohammad, were sent to NIA custody till July 12.

352.title: 17-year-old boy cycles 2,713 km from Hyderabad to Leh in 26 days
352.article_body: A 17-year-old boy, Macharla Venkatesh, cycled from Hyderabad to Leh and covered a distance of 2,713 kilometres in 26 days. Venkatesh said that he travelled between 75 and 130 kilometres per day and mostly stayed near petrol pumps on his journey. He dedicated the journey to the memory of his best friend, who reportedly died in an accident last year.

353.title: Super fast speed for the entire family: Airtel Xstream Fiber
353.article_body: Airtel Xstream Fiber offers plans starting at ₹499 for every family member while catering to their different needs. Customers can enjoy up to 1 Gbps speed and connect multiple devices to the same Wi-Fi with Wi-Fi-only plans. They can also explore All-In-One Entertainment plans offering superfast Wi-Fi speed, 16+ OTT platforms, and 350+ TV channels.

354.title: Words aren't enough, take a bow: Hoggard on Root-Bairstow's 269*-run stand
354.article_body: Discussing the unbeaten partnership of 269 runs between England's Joe Root and Jonny Bairstow in the second innings of the fifth Test against India, ex-England pacer Matthew Hoggard tweeted, "That was amazing." "Words aren't enough, take a bow," added Hoggard. England recorded their most successful run chase in Test history after chasing down a 378-run target in the fifth Test.

355.title: 2 drunk men make hoax bomb call to railway police; arrested in Thane
355.article_body: Government Railway Police (GRP) arrested two men from Thane for allegedly making a hoax call about a bomb. The accused identified as Atul Prajapati and Pradeep Prajapati reportedly called GRP in an inebriated condition and said a bomb was planted inside Ambernath railway station on the intervening night of Sunday and Monday. Police, however, found nothing suspicious after search operation.

356.title: 7 held for cheating people in guise of black magic: Rachakonda Police
356.article_body: Hyderabad's Rachakonda Police have arrested seven members of an interstate fake babas/sadhus gang. The accused persons cheated and threatened people in the guise of black magic and collected huge amounts from them through hawala, police informed on Tuesday. Meanwhile, cash worth over ₹8 lakh, Rudraksha Malas, a money counting machine and mobile phones have been recovered from their possession.

357.title: 2 killed, 1 missing after car falls into gorge in U'khand's Chamoli
357.article_body: Two people died while one went missing after their car fell into a 250-metre deep gorge near Badrinath in Uttarakhand's Chamoli district on Tuesday. The State Disaster Response Force (SDRF) launched rescue operations following the accident. While bodies of two deceased have been retrieved, a search is underway for another woman who was also in the car, an official said.

358.title: Suniel shares 1st look of his character from debut series 'Dharavi Bank'
358.article_body: Actor Suniel Shetty took to Instagram to share the first look of his character from his debut web series 'Dharavi Bank'. "A new avatar, a new medium, a new journey...Presenting the first look of #Thalaiva, from #DharaviBank, my first step into the world of OTTs," he wrote. The web series will also feature Vivek Oberoi and Sonali Kulkarni.

359.title: Actor Amit Sadh gifts bike worth over ₹2 lakh to hairstylist: Report
359.article_body: Actor Amit Sadh has reportedly gifted a Jawa Perak worth over ₹2 lakh to his hairstylist. "Amit felt...his hairstylist...has been doing some great work with his hair and he wanted to reward him with something to show him his appreciation," a source was quoted as saying. Earlier this year, Amit bought a Ducati Hypermotard 950 RVE worth over ₹16 lakh.

360.title: I didn't choose cancer: Chhavi to a troll who blamed her for gaining sympathy
360.article_body: Actress Chhavi Mittal reacted to a troll, who blamed her for gaining sympathy. She shared the screenshot of a comment and criticised it for spreading negativity. The comment read, "Ohh ur here again to gain some sympathy and PR." She responded, "I didn't choose cancer, it chose me...You can't...imagine the courage it takes me to speak about it on...public forum."

361.title: Was practising vegetarianism, turned non-vegetarian during a shoot: Nithya
361.article_body: Actress Nithya Menen has said she was "practising vegetarianism for a while" before the shoot of her upcoming show 'Modern Love Hyderabad'. She added a chef was invited to cook Hyderabadi delicacies. "There was so much Hyderabadi food...At one point, I was like, just give me...chicken...I have to look authentic. So...I keep telling them, they turned me into...non-vegetarian," said Nithya.

362.title: I really liked it, I'm happy for dad: Shruti on Kamal Haasan's film Vikram
362.article_body: Actress Shruti Haasan said that she's very happy about her father, Kamal Haasan's film Vikram's success. "I really liked it, and I am...happy for dad...It's amazing to just have films do so well, especially after the tough times that everyone has faced in the pandemic," she added. "I'm...so excited for everyone involved, it’s been such a resounding success," she said.

363.title: Russian astronauts celebrate capture of Ukraine's Luhansk in space
363.article_body: Russian astronauts aboard International Space Station on Monday celebrated Russia's capture of Ukraine's Luhansk. Astronauts Oleg Artemyev, Denis Matveev and Sergey Korsakov were seen posing with the flag of the self-proclaimed Luhansk People's Republic in a photo. Roscosmos, the Russian space agency, termed the capture a "liberation", stating that it should be celebrated "on Earth and in space".

364.title: 8th largest run-chase in Test history was a stroll in park: Bhogle on India's defeat
364.article_body: Reacting to India's seven-wicket defeat against England in the rescheduled fifth Test, commentator Harsha Bhogle said the bat didn't face any challenge from the ball for the last 200 runs. "The eighth-largest run-chase in [Test] history has been a stroll in the park," he tweeted. Earlier, the record for highest successful run chase against India in Tests was 339 runs.

365.title: Joe Root is the world's best Test batter currently: Virender Sehwag
365.article_body: Virender Sehwag has tweeted that he considers Joe Root as the best batter in Tests currently, following Root's fourth century of the five-match Test series against India. Root scored his fourth century on Day 5 of the rescheduled fifth Test against India. Root has now scored nine Test tons against India which is more than any other player.

366.title: This 7-wicket victory of England should hurt Team India: Irfan on 5th Test
366.article_body: Following India's seven-wicket loss against England in the rescheduled fifth Test in Edgbaston, Irfan Pathan tweeted, "This victory of team England should hurt Team India. That was too easy." Joe Root (142*) and Jonny Bairstow (114*) both scored centuries as England completed their highest-ever chase of 378 runs in Test history. The five-match series ended in a 2-2 draw.

367.title: Telecom industry warns against mobile tower installation scam
367.article_body: The DIPA (Digital Infrastructure Providers Association) and the COAI (Cellular Operators Association of India) have issued a warning against mobile tower installation scam. Fraudsters request for a "government tax" for leasing the premises under the pretence of installing a mobile tower, they said. The fraudsters sometimes also produce fake 'No Objection Certificate' from the IT Ministry.

368.title: Tesla cars now scan for potholes and adjust vehicle suspension
368.article_body: Tesla has confirmed in a new software update that its vehicles can now scan potholes and adjust the suspension to account for rough roads. The owners can activate the feature by selecting 'Comfort' under the Adaptive Suspension Damping setting. However, reportedly the feature is only going to be available in Tesla vehicles with adaptive suspension.

369.title: Fine on TCS in intellectual property case in US halved to $140 mn
369.article_body: The punitive damages levied on Tata Consultancy Services in an intellectual property lawsuit in the US have been halved to $140 million, it said Monday. As per the lawsuit filed by Epic Systems in 2014, TCS stole its trade secrets to develop its own product. TCS, found guilty in 2016, is expected to pay another $140 million in compensatory damages.

370.title: We appeal to citizens to recognise hollow nationalism of BJP: Pawan Khera
370.article_body: Congress' Pawan Khera said, "We appeal to the citizens to recognise hollow nationalism of BJP." Furthermore, Khera said, "BJP party had provided a ticket to Masood Azhar’s disciple Mohammad Farooq Khan from Srinagar’s ward number 33 in a regional election. Nupur Sharma is from your party…How many fringe elements have you been cradling to remain in mainstream?"

371.title: Centre playing with future of 6 lakh students of Delhi: Dy CM Sisodia
371.article_body: Deputy CM Manish Sisodia accused Centre of playing with the future of six lakh students in Delhi by repeatedly transferring senior officers. "Directors...secretaries of higher and technical education departments have been transferred within two-three months," he said. "No one has been appointed to the post of director of Higher Education for 22 days after transfer of previous director," he added.

372.title: U'khand people supported Uniform Civil Code by giving mandate to BJP: Dhami
372.article_body: Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Singh Dhami on Tuesday said the people of the state showed support for Uniform Civil Code (UCC) by giving a mandate to the BJP government. "We've formed a committee that is seeking public opinion...consulting stakeholders and will form a draft. We have kept a six-month period for...procedure, once it concludes, we will implement UCC," Dhami added.

373.title: It was black day for country when Satyendar Jain was arrested: Kejriwal
373.article_body: People say Delhi Minister Satyendar Jain, who was arrested by ED in a money laundering case, is honest, Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal said on Tuesday. "I think it was a black day for the country when Satyendar Jain, who gave not only this country but entire world the concept of mohalla clinic, was picked up and arrested," Kejriwal added.

374.title: Siddaramaiah demands K'taka minister's resignation over PSI recruitment scam
374.article_body: Former Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah on Tuesday demanded the resignation of state Home Minister Araga Jnanendra over the police sub-inspector (PSI) recruitment scam. "In...PSI recruitment scam, the officials shouldn't be blamed. Home Minister Araga Jnanendra is responsible for this scam as well as officials," Siddaramaiah said. Earlier, former ADGP Amrit Paul was arrested in connection with the case.

375.title: Trading platform MarketWolf raises $10 million in Series A round
375.article_body: MarketWolf, a trading platform, has raised $10 million in its Series A funding round. The round was led by Jungle Ventures and Dream Capital. Existing investors such as iSeed, 9Unicorns, Crescent and Riverwalk also participated in the round, the company said. Founded in 2017 by Vishesh Dhingra and Thomas Joseph, the Mumbai-based trading startup aims to help first-time investors.

376.title: Mohali smart school flooded after rainfall, all students shifted to hall
376.article_body: After rains lashed Punjab's Mohali, a 'smart' school in the district's Desumajra was flooded with rainwater. Reports said that after most parts of the school were flooded, the school authorities decided to shift all students into its main hall. "I had...contacted...Municipal Corporation for assistance...they took 24 hours to arrive," the school principal said.

377.title: NDRF team deployed in Kolhapur amid yellow alert due to heavy rain
377.article_body: A team of the National Disaster Response Force (NDRF) has been deployed in Kolhapur after the Indian Meteorological Department (IMD) issued a yellow alert following heavy rains. The IMD has predicted intense rainfall in the western ghats on Tuesday and the next two days. Heavy rains have lashed the areas in western Maharashtra over the last 24 hours.

378.title: Priest tries to sexually assault 17-yr-old girl at her home in TN
378.article_body: A priest was arrested after he allegedly tried to sexually assault a 17-year-old girl, who lived in the neighbourhood, at her house after her grandmother went out for work in Tamil Nadu's Coimbatore. The accused reportedly ran away after the girl, who lived with her grandmother and her sister, raised an alarm. The accused was booked under POCSO Act.

379.title: Couple found dead with their throats slit in UP's Kanpur
379.article_body: A couple was found dead with their throats slit at their residence in Kanpur, Uttar Pradesh. The bodies of the couple, identified as Munna Lal Uttam (62) and Raj Devi (55), were found in separate rooms, police said. It appears that the suspects were known to the deceased, police added. Notably, the couple lived with their son and daughter.

380.title: UP man called for counselling assaults policeman inside police station
380.article_body: A man, who was called for counselling by police in connection with a domestic violence case, allegedly attacked a policeman at a police station in Uttar Pradesh's Mainpuri district. "His family has stated he is a patient of mental illness, we will take that into account if they produce supporting documents. Accused has been booked and detained," Mainpuri ASP said.

381.title: US F-35 fighters arrive in South Korea for joint drills
381.article_body: US Air Force F-35A stealth fighters arrived in South Korea on Tuesday for joint drills amid North Korea tensions. It is reportedly the first known deployment of the US stealth fighter jets to South Korea since December 2017. The deployment is aimed at demonstrating the South Korea-U.S. alliance's strong deterrence and combined defence posture, South Korea's Defence Ministry said.

382.title: NATO nations sign accession protocols for Sweden, Finland
382.article_body: The 30 NATO allies on Tuesday signed off on the accession protocols for Sweden and Finland, sending the membership bids of the two nations to the alliance capitals for legislative approvals. "This is truly a historic moment for Finland...Sweden and...NATO," the alliance's Secretary-General Jens Stoltenberg said. This comes days after Turkey lifted its veto on the Nordic countries' membership bids.

383.title: It was depressing to lie dumped in the backyard: IAS officer as he resigns from service
383.article_body: Daulat Desai, a 2008-batch IAS officer, has resigned from service and wrote on Facebook that it was "quite depressing to lie dumped in the backyard". "I've...voluntarily stepped out of the so-called steel frame, Indian Administrative Service, leaving behind all...Power, Security, Status and Prestige!" he wrote. "Now it's time to shed...'aura' of IAS and be a 'Common Man'," Desai added.

384.title: Sri Lanka planning to stop printing notes as inflation nears 60%
384.article_body: Sri Lanka, which is facing one of the worst economic crises in years, plans to stop printing local currency as inflation nears 60%, the highest in Asia. The nation had been printing currency in order to pay salaries. PM Ranil Wickremesinghe told parliament that talks for a bailout from the IMF are complicated as the nation is bankrupt.

385.title: Joe Root smashes his 28th Test hundred, 11th since 2021
385.article_body: England batter Joe Root smashed his 28th hundred in Test cricket in the rescheduled fifth Test against India. Notably, this is Root's 11th Test hundred in the last two years. Reacting to this, ex-England captain Michael Vaughan tweeted, "He's getting better and better...ridiculous thing to say about England's greatest." Ex-India player Irfan Pathan also tweeted, "Root's an absolute run machine."

386.title: Sania Mirza-Mate Pavic reach maiden mixed doubles semis at Wimbledon
386.article_body: India's Sania Mirza and her Croatian partner Mate Pavic reached their maiden mixed doubles semi-final at Wimbledon on Monday. The sixth seeds beat the fourth-seeded Canadian-Australian pair of Gabriela Dabrowski and John Peers 6-4, 3-6, 7-5 in the quarterfinal. The match lasted one hour 41 minutes. Notably, 35-year-old Sania is playing in her last Wimbledon.

387.title: Why is BJP silent over horrific attacks on Dalits-Adivasis?: Priyanka
387.article_body: Congress General Secretary Priyanka Gandhi Vadra criticised BJP-ruled states and claimed that atrocities on Dalits and tribals have gone up in these states. "Why has the BJP, which is using the names of Dalits-Adivasis for elections, kept silent about these horrific incidents of attacks on Dalits-Adivasis," she said, citing instances of them being attacked in Madhya Pradesh and Uttar Pradesh.

388.title: 4 arrested for kidnapping & assaulting man in Gurugram
388.article_body: Four people have been arrested for allegedly kidnapping and assaulting the caretaker of a warehouse over personal enmity in Gurugram last week, the police said on Monday. A person who is contracted with maintaining the security at the warehouse is the main accused. Two vehicles and a stick used in the crime have been recovered, according to officials.

389.title: Businessman arrested for ITC fraud of ₹35 crore in Mumbai
389.article_body: The Directorate General of Goods and Services Tax Intelligence department arrested a businessman of a Mumbai-based company for allegedly being involved in fraudulent availing of Input Tax Credit (ITC) of ₹35.11 crore. "Despite...24 months having lapsed since the initiation of the investigation, the businessman had not provided...evidence and records sought by the CGST office," an official said.

390.title: Man repeatedly rapes Delhi woman on pretext of marriage, arrested
390.article_body: A Gurugram man was arrested on Monday for allegedly raping a woman on the pretext of marrying her, police said. The woman, in her complaint, stated that the two met on a dating app and the accused raped her for several months. The accused tried raping her again on July 2, following which she approached the police.

391.title: Italy declares state of emergency in regions as longest river dries up
391.article_body: Italy on Monday declared a state of emergency in regions surrounding the river Po amid ongoing drought. The decree will allow authorities to take action, if they deem it necessary, such as imposing water rationing for houses and business establishments. Po, which is Italy's longest river, has significantly shrunk in size in the last two years due to scarce rainfall.

392.title: England record their highest successful chase in Test history vs India, series ends 2-2
392.article_body: England chased down a 378-run target against India in the rescheduled fifth Test to record their highest successful run chase in Test history. England's previous highest successful run chase in Test cricket had come against Australia in Ashes 2019, when they chased down a target of 359. With England's win at Edgbaston, the five-match series ended in a 2-2 draw.

393.title: ₹500 fine for not wearing mask in Chennai from tomorrow amid rise in COVID cases
393.article_body: Amid a rise in COVID-19 cases, the Greater Chennai Corporation has made the wearing of face masks mandatory and announced a fine of ₹500 for those found violating the rule from July 6 (Wednesday). It has asked business establishments to ensure staffers and customers wear masks and maintain social distancing. The city reported 1,066 COVID-19 cases on Monday.

394.title: Twitter sues Indian govt over content removal orders, alleges abuse of power: Report
394.article_body: Twitter has filed a lawsuit against the Indian government seeking to overturn some of its orders to take down content, Reuters reported. Twitter is attempting to get a judicial review on these orders and has alleged abuse of power by Indian officials, the report added. The government had warned Twitter of criminal proceedings if it didn't comply with the orders.

395.title: Vastu expert Chandrashekhar Guruji stabbed to death in K'taka hotel; act caught on CCTV
395.article_body: Saral Vastu fame Chandrashekhar Guruji was stabbed to death in broad daylight in hotel near Unkal Lake in Karnataka on Tuesday. The murder was caught on a CCTV camera installed in the lobby of the hotel and showed one of the two men touching his feet before stabbing him multiple times. The accused escaped from the spot.

396.title: Show wasn't good enough: Adele on backlash for postponing Las Vegas show
396.article_body: Singer-songwriter Adele has reacted to the backlash she faced over postponing the Las Vegas residency at Caesars Palace, saying that the show wasn't good enough. "You can't buy me...I'm not going to just do a show because I have to or because people will be let down or because we're going to lose loads of money," she added.

397.title: PMC disaster management cell warns about 39 flood-prone spots
397.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation's disaster management cell warned there are 39 flood-prone spots in the city. It said the spots will get flooded if 28,000 cusecs of water is released from Khadakwasla dam ahead of heavy rainfall likely in coming days. Encroachments, dumping of debris in river beds and nullahs have decreased the water flowing capacity of natural bodies, it added.

398.title: SC judges pronounced Nupur Sharma guilty without trial: Retired judges in open letter
398.article_body: An open letter signed by 15 retired judges, 77 retired bureaucrats and 25 retired armed forces officers against Supreme Court's observations on Nupur Sharma has been sent to CJI NV Ramana. "Forcing a petitioner by such damning observations, pronouncing her guilty without trial, and denial of access to justice...can never be a facet of a democratic society," the letter stated.

399.title: Meghalaya YouTuber educated by police on responsible news circulation
399.article_body: A YouTuber was summoned by Meghalaya Police on Tuesday for allegedly circulating "news-like" sensitive information without following proper procedure as per norms to function as a media outlet. He received education on how to share information of public interest responsibly. He was asked to abstain from using sensitive information to push his viewership without verification from authorities.

400.title: Woman falls off Ferris wheel in WB; suffers severe head injuries
400.article_body: A 26-year-old woman suffered severe head injuries after she reportedly fell off the Ferris wheel at Ramlila ground in West Bengal's Kolkata. The incident occurred on Sunday and the woman, who is said to be in a stable but serious condition, is currently being treated at a hospital. Three people, including the ride's operator, were arrested in the matter.

401.title: Company booked under Copyright Act for using Disney characters in birthday products
401.article_body: Maharashtra Police booked two persons and a company located in Thane district for allegedly violating the Copyright Act by using Disney characters in birthday materials without permission. The case was registered based on a complaint lodged by an official of Disney Enterprises. The police conducted raids at godowns of the accused and seized materials worth over ₹1.81 lakh.
